entry.title: 【BBC六分钟英语】泰国50年老汤真的能吃吗？
entry.content:
【英文脚本】

Phil
Hello. This is 6 Minute English from BBC Learning English. I’m Phil.

Beth
And I’m Beth.

Phil
Most people have eaten some unusual food at least once in their life. What’s the most unusual thing you’ve ever eaten, Beth?

Beth
Oh, I ate camel in Australia, and I really didn’t like it, to be honest. What about you?

Phil
I ate caiman in Northern Argentina, and it was delicious!

Beth
Oh, OK. Good!

Phil
Well, in this programme we’ll be discussing some very unusual food known as ‘forever food’ – dishes, like stews and soups, which can be kept going day after day, year after year. We’ll also be learning some useful new vocabulary, all of which you can download, along with a worksheet for this programme, at our website, bbclearningenglish.com.

Beth
But let’s get back to forever food, and a Bangkok restaurant called, Wattana Panich, that’s famous for a soup which has been cooking for over 50 years! Here’s radio listener, David Shirley, who called BBC World Service programme, The Food Chain, after tasting the soup himself:

David Shirley
I had never heard of a perpetual stew before, but the first time I’d ever heard about it was when I was in Bangkok. I found a stew that had been simmering for fifty years.

Phil
David tasted perpetual stew, a pot into which ingredients are placed and cooked continuously. The pot is never completely emptied. Instead, new ingredients and water are added when necessary and left simmering – cooking at a temperature just below boiling so that the food bubbles gently.

Beth
A 50-year-old soup might not be to everyone’s taste, but forever foods are surprisingly common. And, Phil, I have a question for you about Wattana Panich’s 50-year-old soup. What do you think is the main ingredient? Is it: a) beef? b) chicken? or, c) vegetables?

Phil
Oh, I think vegetables. I think that’s probably safer.

Beth
OK. Well, we’ll find out the correct answer later in the programme. It’s not just Bangkok where people cook forever foods. Fuchsia Dunlop is a writer and cook specialising in Chinese food. Here, she tells BBC World Service programme, ‘The Food Chain’, about a Chinese stew that is rumoured to be 100 years old:

Fuchsia Dunlop
In China they sometimes, you know, professionals talk about having a bǎinián laolu which means, like, a 100-year-old-broth. So, I don’t know if this is strictly true, but theoretically as long as you have a good practice of hygiene - which is to say that you always skim it, and boil it every day, and also replenish it as needed with more water, more salt, more spices, and you know, you keep tasting - then it just gets richer and richer.

Phil
Cooks need to replenish a forever stew, to fill it up again with fresh ingredients before it’s completely eaten. By being regularly replenished, some dishes are rumoured to last 100 years.

Beth
Wow, that is a long time! Fuchsia doesn’t know if it’s strictly true, or completely true, that the same stew has really lasted 100 years, but she thinks it’s possible in theory, as long as it’s kept safe and hygienic through boiling.

Phil
Professor Martha Carlin is a historian with a special interest in medieval cookery. Here, she explains to BBC World Service programme, ‘The Food Chain’, why long- lasting foods could have been familiar to people in the Middle Ages:

Prof Martha Carlin
In theory, it would make sense to think that people who didn’t have matches or fire starters, for whom starting a fire from scratch was quite a cumbersome process, would naturally want to keep a stew pot bubbling if they had the means to do that, and to avoid the labour of constantly restarting the fire, and also to make sure that they had a hot meal waiting at any time.

Beth
Having hot food bubbling away on the fire means there is always something ready to eat, and avoids having to start a fire from scratch. When you do something, like cook food or make a fire, from scratch, you do it from the beginning, without the help of anything that has already been made.

Phil
Starting a fire is also cumbersome, an adjective meaning difficult to do, taking time and effort. But Professor Carlin says only rich families were able to afford enough wood to keep a fire going all day. Anyway, all this talk of food has made me hungry, Beth, so what was the answer to your question?

Beth
Ah, I asked you what the main ingredient is in the Bangkok stew, and you said vegetables. And I’m afraid that’s wrong. It was, in fact, beef. OK, let’s recap the vocabulary we’ve learned in this programme about forever foods such as perpetual stew, a pot of stew into which new ingredients are regularly added, allowing the dish to be eaten over a long time.

Phil
When food is simmering, it’s cooking at a temperature slightly below boiling so that it bubbles gently.

Beth
The verb replenish means to fill something up again.

Phil
If something is not strictly true, it’s not completely or entirely true.

Beth
When you do an activity such as cooking, from scratch, you do it from the beginning, without using anything that has already been made.

Phil
And finally, if an activity is cumbersome, it’s difficult to do and takes a lot of time and effort. Once again, our six minutes are up. Remember to visit our website, bbclearningenglish.com, where you’ll find a worksheet and a quiz related to this programme, and we’ll see you again soon for more trending topics and useful vocabulary, here at 6 Minute English. Goodbye for now!

Beth
Bye!

【中英文双语脚本】

Phil(菲尔)
I’m Phil.
你好。这是来自 BBC Learning English 的六分钟英语。我是 Phil。

Beth(贝丝)
And I’m Beth.
我是 Beth。

Phil(菲尔)
Most people have eaten some unusual food at least once in their life. What’s the most unusual thing you’ve ever eaten, Beth?
大多数人一生中至少吃过一次不寻常的食物。贝丝，你吃过的最不寻常的东西是什么？

Beth(贝丝)
Oh, I ate camel in Australia, and I really didn’t like it, to be honest. What about you?
哦，我在澳大利亚吃过骆驼，说实话，我真的不喜欢它。你呢？

Phil(菲尔)
I ate caiman in Northern Argentina, and it was delicious!
我在阿根廷北部吃了凯门鳄，很好吃！

Beth(贝丝)
Oh, OK. Good!
哦，好的，很好！

Phil(菲尔)
Well, in this programme we’ll be discussing some very unusual food known as ‘forever food’ – dishes, like stews and soups, which can be kept going day after day, year after year. We’ll also be learning some useful new vocabulary, all of which you can download, along with a worksheet for this programme, at our website, bbclearningenglish.com.
好吧，在这个节目中，我们将讨论一些非常不寻常的食物，被称为 “永恒的食物”–像炖菜和汤一样的菜肴，可以日复一日，年复一年地保持下去。我们还将学习一些有用的新词汇，所有这些词汇都可以在我们的网站上下载，以及该节目的工作表，bbclearningenglish.com。

Beth(贝丝)
But let’s get back to forever food, and a Bangkok restaurant called, Wattana Panich, that’s famous for a soup which has been cooking for over 50 years! Here’s radio listener, David Shirley, who called BBC World Service programme, The Food Chain, after tasting the soup himself:
但是让我们回到永恒的食物，一家名为 Wattana Panich 的曼谷餐厅，它以已经烹饪了 50 多年的汤而闻名！这是电台听众大卫·雪莉 在亲自品尝了汤后致电 BBC 世界服务节目 The Food Chain：

David Shirley(大卫·雪莉)
I had never heard of a perpetual stew before, but the first time I’d ever heard about it was when I was in Bangkok. I found a stew that had been simmering for fifty years.
我以前从未听说过永久炖菜，但我第一次听说它是在曼谷的时候。我找到了一个炖了五十年的炖菜。

Phil(菲尔)
David tasted perpetual stew, a pot into which ingredients are placed and cooked continuously. The pot is never completely emptied. Instead, new ingredients and water are added when necessary and left simmering – cooking at a temperature just below boiling so that the food bubbles gently.
大卫尝到了永久炖菜的味道，这是一个将食材放入其中并不断烹饪的锅。这个罐子永远不会完全清空。相反，必要时加入新的成分和水并炖着 —— 在略低于沸腾的温度下烹饪，使食物轻轻冒泡。

Beth(贝丝)
A 50-year-old soup might not be to everyone’s taste, but forever foods are surprisingly common. And, Phil, I have a question for you about Wattana Panich’s 50-year-old soup. What do you think is the main ingredient? Is it: a) beef? b) chicken? or, c) vegetables?
50 年的汤可能并不符合每个人的口味，但永恒的食物却出奇地普遍。菲尔，我有一个关于 Wattana Panich 的 50 年老汤的问题要问你。您认为主要成分是什么？是：a） 牛肉？b） 鸡肉？或者，c） 蔬菜？

Phil(菲尔)
Oh, I think vegetables. I think that’s probably safer.
哦，我想是蔬菜。我认为这可能更安全。

Beth(贝丝)
OK. Well, we’ll find out the correct answer later in the programme. It’s not just Bangkok where people cook forever foods. Fuchsia Dunlop is a writer and cook specialising in Chinese food. Here, she tells BBC World Service programme, ‘The Food Chain’, about a Chinese stew that is rumoured to be 100 years old:
还行。好吧，我们将在节目的后面找到正确答案。不仅仅是曼谷，人们永远烹饪食物。Fuchsia Dunlop 是一位作家和厨师，专门研究中餐。在这里，她告诉 BBC 世界服务节目“食物链”，关于一种据传已有 100 年历史的中国炖菜：

Fuchsia Dunlop(紫红色邓禄普)
In China they sometimes, you know, professionals talk about having a bǎinián laolu which means, like, a 100-year-old-broth. So, I don’t know if this is strictly true, but theoretically as long as you have a good practice of hygiene - which is to say that you always skim it, and boil it every day, and also replenish it as needed with more water, more salt, more spices, and you know, you keep tasting - then it just gets richer and richer.
在中国，专业人士有时会谈论 bǎinián laolu，意思是，就像 100 年的肉汤一样。所以，我不知道这是否严格来说是正确的，但从理论上讲，只要你有良好的卫生习惯 —— 也就是说，你总是撇去它，每天煮它，并根据需要补充更多的水、更多的盐、更多的香料，你知道，你不断品尝 —— 那么它就会变得越来越丰富。

Phil(菲尔)
Cooks need to replenish a forever stew, to fill it up again with fresh ingredients before it’s completely eaten. By being regularly replenished, some dishes are rumoured to last 100 years.
厨师需要补充永远的炖菜，在完全食用之前再次用新鲜食材填满。通过定期补充，有传言称有些菜肴可以使用 100 年。

Beth(贝丝)
Wow, that is a long time! Fuchsia doesn’t know if it’s strictly true, or completely true, that the same stew has really lasted 100 years, but she thinks it’s possible in theory, as long as it’s kept safe and hygienic through boiling.
哇，好好长的时间啊！Fuchsia 不知道同样的炖菜真的持续了 100 年是严格正确的还是完全正确的，但她认为理论上是可能的，只要它在煮沸时保持安全和卫生。

Phil(菲尔)
Professor Martha Carlin is a historian with a special interest in medieval cookery. Here, she explains to BBC World Service programme, ‘The Food Chain’, why long- lasting foods could have been familiar to people in the Middle Ages:
玛莎·卡林 教授是一位历史学家，对中世纪烹饪特别感兴趣。在这里，她向 BBC 世界服务节目“食物链”解释了为什么中世纪的人们会熟悉长效食物：

Prof Martha Carlin(Martha Carlin 教授)
In theory, it would make sense to think that people who didn’t have matches or fire starters, for whom starting a fire from scratch was quite a cumbersome process, would naturally want to keep a stew pot bubbling if they had the means to do that, and to avoid the labour of constantly restarting the fire, and also to make sure that they had a hot meal waiting at any time.
从理论上讲，认为没有火柴或点火器的人是有道理的，对他们来说从头开始生火是一个相当繁琐的过程，如果他们有办法的话，自然会希望让炖锅冒泡，并避免不断点火的劳动。 还要确保他们随时都有热饭等着他们。

Beth(贝丝)
Having hot food bubbling away on the fire means there is always something ready to eat, and avoids having to start a fire from scratch. When you do something, like cook food or make a fire, from scratch, you do it from the beginning, without the help of anything that has already been made.
让热食在火上冒泡意味着总有现成的东西可以吃，并且不必从头开始生火。当你从头开始做某事时，比如做饭或生火，你从头开始做，不需要任何已经完成的帮助。

Phil(菲尔)
Starting a fire is also cumbersome, an adjective meaning difficult to do, taking time and effort. But Professor Carlin says only rich families were able to afford enough wood to keep a fire going all day. Anyway, all this talk of food has made me hungry, Beth, so what was the answer to your question?
生火也很麻烦，这个形容词的意思是很难做到，需要时间和精力。但卡林教授说，只有富裕家庭才能买得起足够的木材来维持一整天的火势。不管怎样，所有这些关于食物的讨论都让我饿了，贝丝，那么你的问题的答案是什么？

Beth(贝丝)
Ah, I asked you what the main ingredient is in the Bangkok stew, and you said vegetables. And I’m afraid that’s wrong. It was, in fact, beef. OK, let’s recap the vocabulary we’ve learned in this programme about forever foods such as perpetual stew, a pot of stew into which new ingredients are regularly added, allowing the dish to be eaten over a long time.
啊，我问你曼谷炖菜的主要成分是什么，你说蔬菜。恐怕这是错误的。事实上，它是牛肉。好，让我们回顾一下我们在这个节目中学到的关于永恒食物的词汇，比如永久炖菜，一锅炖菜，定期添加新成分，让这道菜可以长时间食用。

Phil(菲尔)
When food is simmering, it’s cooking at a temperature slightly below boiling so that it bubbles gently.
当食物炖煮时，它会在略低于沸腾的温度下烹饪，以便轻轻冒泡。

Beth(贝丝)
The verb replenish means to fill something up again.
动词 replenish 的意思是再次填充某物。

Phil(菲尔)
If something is not strictly true, it’s not completely or entirely true.
如果某件事不是严格正确的，那么它就不完全或完全正确。

Beth(贝丝)
When you do an activity such as cooking, from scratch, you do it from the beginning, without using anything that has already been made.
当您从头开始进行烹饪等活动时，您可以从头开始进行，而无需使用已经制作的任何产品。

Phil(菲尔)
And finally, if an activity is cumbersome, it’s difficult to do and takes a lot of time and effort. Once again, our six minutes are up. Remember to visit our website, bbclearningenglish.com, where you’ll find a worksheet and a quiz related to this programme, and we’ll see you again soon for more trending topics and useful vocabulary, here at 6 Minute English. Goodbye for now!
最后，如果一项活动很麻烦，那就很难做，并且需要大量的时间和精力。我们的六分钟又结束了。记得访问我们的网站 bbclearningenglish.com，在那里您可以找到与此计划相关的工作表和测验，我们很快就会再次见到您，了解更多热门话题和有用的词汇，请访问 6 Minute English。再见！

Beth(贝丝)
Bye!
再见！

【核心词汇】

perpetual stew

pot of stew into which new ingredients are regularly added so that the food is kept going and can be eaten over a long time
永续炖菜
长期熬制的炖菜，不断添加新的食材以保持其持续供应并可长期食用。
The perpetual stew simmered gently on the back burner, a constant source of comfort in the chilly kitchen.
寒冷的厨房里，后炉子上慢炖着永续炖菜，它持续地带来慰藉。

simmering

cooking at a temperature slightly below boiling so that the food bubbles gently
慢炖
以低于沸点的温度烹调，使食物轻轻冒泡。
The sauce was simmering gently, its aroma filling the kitchen.
酱汁在轻轻地炖着，香味弥漫着整个厨房。

replenish

fill up again
补充
再次装满；补充。
We need to replenish our supplies of food and water before the long journey.
在长途跋涉之前，我们需要补充食物和水。

not strictly true

not completely or entirely true
并非完全属实
并非完全或全部属实。
His account of the events was not strictly true, omitting several key details.
他对事件的描述并非完全属实，省略了一些关键细节。

from scratch

from the beginning, without the help of anything that has already been made
从零开始
从头开始，没有任何现成的东西的帮助。
She baked the cake entirely from scratch, using only fresh ingredients.
她完全从零开始烘焙蛋糕，只使用新鲜的食材。

cumbersome

difficult to do; taking a lot of time and effort
繁琐的
难以做到；费时费力。
The process was cumbersome and inefficient, requiring numerous steps and approvals.
这个过程繁琐且低效，需要许多步骤和批准。

在公众号里输入6位数字，获取【对话音频、英文文本、中文翻译、核心词汇和高级词汇表】电子档，6位数字【暗号】在文章的最后一张图片，如【220728】，表示22年7月28日这一期。公众号没有的文章说明还没有制作相关资料。年度合集在B站【六分钟英语】工房获取，每年共计300+文档，感谢支持！

entry.title: 【BBC六分钟英语】你喝了足够的水吗？
entry.content:
【英文脚本】

Phil
Hello. This is 6 Minute English from BBC Learning English. I’m Phil.

Beth
And I’m Beth. Nowadays, I often see people carrying water bottles with them to make sure they drink enough. How much water do you drink a day, Phil?

Phil
Oh, I don’t know. Maybe about a litre?

Beth
OK. And do you know how much water you should drink a day?

Phil
I think it’s probably about two litres.

Beth
Ah, well, the number many people have heard is two litres a day. Of course, everyone needs to drink some water - over half the human body is made up of it. But exactly how much water do we need to stay healthy? That’s what we’ll be discussing in this programme, along with some useful new vocabulary as well.

Phil
And speaking of vocabulary, remember you can download all the new words and phrases from this programme, plus worksheet exercises to help you learn them, on our website, bbclearningenglish.com.

Beth
Great! But first I have a question for you, Phil. I mentioned that over half the human body consists of water, but there’s an even higher percentage of water in our blood. But how much? Is our blood: a) around 80% water? b) around 90% water? or, c) 100% water?

Phil
I think it’s around 80% water.

Beth
OK, I will reveal the correct answer later in the programme. Our blood needs water so it can carry nutrients to the body’s cells and organs. The amount recommended is often given as two litres a day. But why? Here to discuss this with BBC World Service programme, The Food Chain, is biologist, Professor John Speakman:

Professor John Speakman
So, I’m not sure how it was arrived at but it seems to be a number that has taken grip on a very large number of countries. So, if you look at government recommendations around the world, they’re pretty much all the same. They pretty much all say everybody’s got to be drinking two litres of water.

Phil
Professor Speakman doesn’t know how the number of two litres a day was arrived at – how it was decided or calculated. Nevertheless, the idea of drinking two litres a day has taken grip on many governments around the world. When you say an idea has taken grip on something, you mean it’s taken control of it.

Beth
Yes, Professor Speakman says that pretty much all governments are giving pretty much the same recommendation. He uses the phrase, pretty much, to mean almost. For example, ‘pretty much all governments advise drinking two litres a day’ means ‘almost all governments advise it’.

Phil
What Professor Speakman doesn’t have, however, is any scientific evidence for this advice. The number of exactly two litres isn’t based on scientific fact, it’s more of a ballpark figure – a number which is a guess, but which you still believe is approximately correct.

Beth
Actually, the amount of water in our bodies is changing all the time. Like your bank balance, which goes down when you spend money, your body loses water all the time, when you breathe, sweat, or go to the toilet. Exactly how much you need to drink depends on how much water your body needs to replace, and that mainly depends on your size.

Phil
But what happens when we drink less than we should? Here’s hydration expert, Dr Nidia Rodriguez-Sanchez, describing the effects of dehydration to BBC World Service’s, The Food Chain.

Dr Nidia Rodriguez-Sanchez
And also, many times we start getting dehydrated and we don’t realise we are dehydrated. So it’s very common that we feel tired, or we feel, like, with a bit of a headache, or even we think we’re hungry, and we go and get some food. And actually what is happening is that we are thirsty, that we are dehydrated, we are starting to show some signs or some symptoms of dehydration.

Phil
Dr Sanchez describes the effects of dehydration, the condition of not having enough water in your body so that you feel ill or weak. She mentions feeling tired, having a headache or a dry mouth as symptoms of dehydration. Symptoms are signs or feelings in the body showing the presence of some illness or condition.

Beth
So, whether you drink a little more, or a little less, it seems that around two litres of water a day is a good way to keep your blood and body healthy. Speaking of which, Phil, it’s time to reveal the answer to my question, what percentage of our blood is water? You said 80%, and the answer is 90%. Our blood consists of around 90% water. OK, let’s recap the vocabulary we’ve used, starting with the phrase to arrive at a number, meaning to decide it by doing calculations.

Phil
If an idea takes grip on something, it takes control of it.

Beth
The phrase pretty much means almost; for example, pretty much everyone likes chocolate, which means almost everyone likes chocolate.

Phil
A ballpark figure is a phrase meaning a number which is an acceptably accurate approximation.

Beth
Dehydration is the condition of not having enough water in your body so that you feel ill or weak.

Phil
And finally, a symptom is a sign or feeling in the body showing the presence of an illness or condition. Once again, our six minutes are up. Why not join me now and head over to our website, bbclearningenglish.com, download the worksheet for this programme, and test yourself to see how much you remember? See you there soon!

Beth
Bye!

【中英文双语脚本】

Phil(菲尔)
I’m Phil.
你好。这是来自 BBC Learning English 的六分钟英语。我是 Phil。

Beth(贝丝)
And I’m Beth. Nowadays, I often see people carrying water bottles with them to make sure they drink enough. How much water do you drink a day, Phil?
我是 Beth。如今，我经常看到人们随身携带水瓶以确保他们喝得足够。你每天喝多少水，Phil？

Phil(菲尔)
Oh, I don’t know. Maybe about a litre?
哦，我不知道。也许大约一升？

Beth(贝丝)
OK. And do you know how much water you should drink a day?
还行。你知道你每天应该喝多少水吗？

Phil(菲尔)
I think it’s probably about two litres.
我想大概是两升。

Beth(贝丝)
Ah, well, the number many people have heard is two litres a day. Of course, everyone needs to drink some water - over half the human body is made up of it. But exactly how much water do we need to stay healthy? That’s what we’ll be discussing in this programme, along with some useful new vocabulary as well.
啊，嗯，很多人听说的数字是每天两升。当然，每个人都需要喝一些水 —— 人体的一半以上是由水组成的。但是，我们究竟需要多少水才能保持健康呢？这就是我们将在本节目中讨论的内容，以及一些有用的新词汇。

Phil(菲尔)
And speaking of vocabulary, remember you can download all the new words and phrases from this programme, plus worksheet exercises to help you learn them, on our website, bbclearningenglish.com.
说到词汇，请记住，您可以在我们的网站上下载该节目中的所有新单词和短语，以及帮助您学习它们的工作表练习，bbclearningenglish.com。

Beth(贝丝)
Great! But first I have a question for you, Phil. I mentioned that over half the human body consists of water, but there’s an even higher percentage of water in our blood. But how much? Is our blood: a) around 80% water? b) around 90% water? or, c) 100% water?
太好了！但首先我有一个问题要问你，Phil。我提到过，人体的一半以上由水组成，但我们血液中的水比例甚至更高。但多少呢？我们的血液是否：a） 大约 80% 是水？b） 大约 90% 的水？或者，c） 100% 水？

Phil(菲尔)
I think it’s around 80% water.
我认为大约 80% 是水。

Beth(贝丝)
OK, I will reveal the correct answer later in the programme. Our blood needs water so it can carry nutrients to the body’s cells and organs. The amount recommended is often given as two litres a day. But why? Here to discuss this with BBC World Service programme, The Food Chain, is biologist, Professor John Speakman:
好的，我将在稍后的节目中透露正确答案。我们的血液需要水，这样才能将营养物质输送到身体的细胞和器官。建议的量通常为每天 2 升。但是为什么？在这里与 BBC 世界服务节目《食物链》讨论这个问题的是生物学家约翰·斯皮克曼教授：

Professor John Speakman(John Speakman 教授)
So, I’m not sure how it was arrived at but it seems to be a number that has taken grip on a very large number of countries. So, if you look at government recommendations around the world, they’re pretty much all the same. They pretty much all say everybody’s got to be drinking two litres of water.
所以，我不确定它是如何得出的，但这个数字似乎已经控制了非常多的国家。所以，如果你看一下世界各地的政府建议，它们几乎都是一样的。他们几乎都说每个人都必须喝两升水。

Phil(菲尔)
Professor Speakman doesn’t know how the number of two litres a day was arrived at – how it was decided or calculated. Nevertheless, the idea of drinking two litres a day has taken grip on many governments around the world. When you say an idea has taken grip on something, you mean it’s taken control of it.
Speakman 教授不知道每天 2 升的水数是如何得出的 —— 它是如何决定或计算的。尽管如此，每天喝两升的想法已经影响了世界各地的许多政府。当你说一个想法已经抓住了某件事时，你的意思是它已经控制了它。

Beth(贝丝)
Yes, Professor Speakman says that pretty much all governments are giving pretty much the same recommendation. He uses the phrase, pretty much, to mean almost. For example, ‘pretty much all governments advise drinking two litres a day’ means ‘almost all governments advise it’.
是的，斯皮克曼教授说，几乎所有政府都给出了几乎相同的建议。他用这个词，几乎是，意思几乎。例如，“几乎所有政府都建议每天喝两升”的意思是“几乎所有政府都建议这样做”。

Phil(菲尔)
What Professor Speakman doesn’t have, however, is any scientific evidence for this advice. The number of exactly two litres isn’t based on scientific fact, it’s more of a ballpark figure – a number which is a guess, but which you still believe is approximately correct.
然而，斯皮克曼教授没有为这个建议提供任何科学证据。正好 2 升的数字不是基于科学事实，它更像是一个大概的数字 —— 一个猜测的数字，但你仍然相信它大致正确。

Beth(贝丝)
Actually, the amount of water in our bodies is changing all the time. Like your bank balance, which goes down when you spend money, your body loses water all the time, when you breathe, sweat, or go to the toilet. Exactly how much you need to drink depends on how much water your body needs to replace, and that mainly depends on your size.
实际上，我们体内的水量一直在变化。就像你花钱时银行余额会下降一样，当你呼吸、出汗或上厕所时，你的身体会一直流失水分。你到底需要喝多少水取决于你的身体需要补充多少水，而这主要取决于你的体型。

Phil(菲尔)
But what happens when we drink less than we should? Here’s hydration expert, Dr Nidia Rodriguez-Sanchez, describing the effects of dehydration to BBC World Service’s, The Food Chain.
但是，当我们喝得少于我们应该喝的少时会发生什么呢？这是补水专家 Nidia Rodriguez-Sanchez 博士向 BBC 国际频道的 The Food Chain 描述脱水的影响。

Dr Nidia Rodriguez-Sanchez(Nidia Rodriguez-Sanchez 医师)
And also, many times we start getting dehydrated and we don’t realise we are dehydrated. So it’s very common that we feel tired, or we feel, like, with a bit of a headache, or even we think we’re hungry, and we go and get some food. And actually what is happening is that we are thirsty, that we are dehydrated, we are starting to show some signs or some symptoms of dehydration.
而且，很多时候我们开始脱水，但我们没有意识到我们脱水了。因此，我们感到疲倦，或者我们感到有点头痛，甚至我们认为我们饿了，然后我们去吃点东西，这是很常见的。实际上，我们正在发生的事情是我们口渴，我们脱水，我们开始出现一些脱水的迹象或症状。

Phil(菲尔)
Dr Sanchez describes the effects of dehydration, the condition of not having enough water in your body so that you feel ill or weak. She mentions feeling tired, having a headache or a dry mouth as symptoms of dehydration. Symptoms are signs or feelings in the body showing the presence of some illness or condition.
Sanchez 博士描述了脱水的影响，脱水是指体内水分不足，以至于您感到不适或虚弱的情况。她提到感到疲倦、头痛或口干是脱水的症状。症状是体内显示存在某种疾病或病症的迹象或感觉。

Beth(贝丝)
So, whether you drink a little more, or a little less, it seems that around two litres of water a day is a good way to keep your blood and body healthy. Speaking of which, Phil, it’s time to reveal the answer to my question, what percentage of our blood is water? You said 80%, and the answer is 90%. Our blood consists of around 90% water. OK, let’s recap the vocabulary we’ve used, starting with the phrase to arrive at a number, meaning to decide it by doing calculations.
因此，无论您多喝一点还是少喝一点，每天喝两升左右的水似乎都是保持血液和身体健康的好方法。说到这里，Phil，是时候揭示我问题的答案了，我们血液中有多少百分比是水？你说 80%，答案是 90%。我们的血液由大约 90% 的水组成。好，让我们回顾一下我们使用的词汇，从短语开始得出一个数字，意思是通过计算来决定它。

Phil(菲尔)
If an idea takes grip on something, it takes control of it.
如果一个想法抓住了某件事，它就会控制它。

Beth(贝丝)
The phrase pretty much means almost; for example, pretty much everyone likes chocolate, which means almost everyone likes chocolate.
这个短语的意思是几乎；例如，几乎每个人都喜欢巧克力，这意味着几乎每个人都喜欢巧克力。

Phil(菲尔)
A ballpark figure is a phrase meaning a number which is an acceptably accurate approximation.
一个大概的数字是一个短语，意思是一个数字，这是一个可以接受的准确近似值。

Beth(贝丝)
Dehydration is the condition of not having enough water in your body so that you feel ill or weak.
脱水是指体内没有足够的水分，以至于您感到不适或虚弱的情况。

Phil(菲尔)
And finally, a symptom is a sign or feeling in the body showing the presence of an illness or condition. Once again, our six minutes are up. Why not join me now and head over to our website, bbclearningenglish.com, download the worksheet for this programme, and test yourself to see how much you remember? See you there soon!
最后，症状是体内表明存在疾病或病症的迹象或感觉。我们的六分钟又结束了。为什么不现在就加入我，前往我们的网站，bbclearningenglish.com，下载此计划的工作表，并测试自己，看看您记得多少呢？期待很快与您相见！

Beth(贝丝)
Bye!
再见！

【核心词汇】

arrive at

calculate; decide on it after doing calculations
到达
计算；经过计算后决定
The delegates arrived at a compromise after hours of negotiation.
经过数小时的谈判，代表们达成了一项妥协。

take grip on

take control of
掌控
控制
She took a firm grip on the situation and resolved the crisis efficiently.
她牢牢掌控局面，高效地解决了危机。

pretty much

almost; almost completely
几乎；差不多
几乎；几乎完全
The project is pretty much finished; we just need to finalize a few details.
项目几乎完成了；我们只需要完成一些细节。

ballpark figure

a number which is a guess but an acceptably accurate approximation
大概数字
一个数字，它是猜测的，但却是可以接受的准确近似值
They gave me a ballpark figure for the cost of the renovation.
他们给了我装修费用的一个大概数字。

dehydration

condition of not having enough water in your body so that you feel ill or weak
脱水
身体缺水以致感到不适或虚弱的状况
Prolonged exposure to the sun can lead to severe dehydration.
长时间暴露在阳光下会导致严重脱水。

symptom

sign or feeling in the body showing the presence of illness or a condition
症状
身体上显示疾病或状况存在的征兆或感觉
A high fever is a common symptom of influenza.
高烧是流感的常见症状。

在公众号里输入6位数字，获取【对话音频、英文文本、中文翻译、核心词汇和高级词汇表】电子档，6位数字【暗号】在文章的最后一张图片，如【220728】，表示22年7月28日这一期。公众号没有的文章说明还没有制作相关资料。年度合集在B站【六分钟英语】工房获取，每年共计300+文档，感谢支持！

entry.title: 考研词汇精选-060
entry.content:
01 contemporary [kənˈtemprəri]

adj.当代的，现代的；同时代的；n.同时代的人；同龄人，同辈

词根助记
con共同+ tempor时间+ ary….的→同一时间的 →contemporary当代的，现代的

adj．当代的，现代的
The lady is admiring a contemporary painting.
这位女士正欣赏着一幅当代画作。

A majority of the contemporary definitions of play focus on several key criteria.
大多数对游戏的当代定义都集中在几个关键标准上。
来源：剑14 Test3 阅读

n.同时代的人
William James introduced the distinction in 1892, and contemporaries of his, such as Charles Cooley, added to the developing debate.
威廉·詹姆斯(WilliamJames)在1892年引l入了这种区分，而他的同时代人，如查尔斯·库利(Charles Cooley)，则加入了不断发展的辩论。
来源：剑9 Test4 阅读

02 crew [kruː]

（有专门技术的）一组工作人员，（飞机、轮船等的）全体工作人员；一群人；专业团队

谐音助记
crew谐音：可入；“全体工作人员”都认为这款产品可入。

（有专门技术的）一组工作人员，（飞机、轮船等的）全体工作人员
The crew members lined up in the morning before beginning work.
每天早上开始工作前，全体船员都要先列队。

The ship’s crew had the daunting task of repairing the rudder at sea, and only succeeded at the second attempt.
船员们在海上修理舵是一项艰巨的任务，但在第二次尝试时才成功。
来源：剑13 Test4 阅读

03

04

05

06

07

08

09

10

entry.title: 考研词汇精选-059
entry.content:
01 attachment [əˈtætʃmənt]

n. 依恋;（机器的、通过邮件发送的）附件；连接物；附件

象形助记

n.依恋
There is a deep sense of attachment between husband and wife.
丈夫和妻子之间有着深深的依恋。

It is also released by women in childbirth, strengthening the attachment between mother and baby.
女性在分娩时也会释放这种激素，从而加强母亲和婴儿之间的依恋。
来源：剑13 Test2 阅读

02 smash [smæʃ]

v.粉碎，击溃；猛冲；碰碎，摔碎；n.破碎（声），猛撞；巨大的成功；adj极为成功的

联想助记
s（死）+mash（捣碎）→往死里捣→smash”粉碎”

v.粉碎，击溃
The football smashed the glass into pieces.
这个足球把玻璃撞成了碎片。

03

n.代表（某人），因为某人；利益；赞同，支持

联想助记
代表别人，就要成为（be）半个（half）他。

n.代表（某人），因为某人
Lord Bao attended the conference on behalf of Baicizhan.
包大人代表百词斩参加了这次会议。

A campaigner on behalf of remote so-called ‘tribal’ peoples, …
一个代表偏远的所谓“部落”民族的竞选者
来源：剑15 Test1 阅读

04 grip [ɡrɪp]

n.掌握，控制，影响；紧握，握力；v. 握紧，抓牢

象形助记

n.掌握，控制，影响
We need to tighten the grip we have on the market.
我们得加强对市场的控制力。

Water-borne diseases had a much looser grip on the Japanese population than those in Britain.
与英国相比，水传播疾病对日本人口的影响要小得多。
来源：剑10 Test2 阅读

05 panorama [ˌpæn.ərˈɑː.mə $ -əˈræm.ə]

n.全景，概观

词根助记
pan广泛的+ orama视力→广泛视力范围所及的→panorama全景，全貌

n.全景，概观
This panorama shows the entire downtown skyline.
这张全景显示了整个城市的天际线。

06 inundate [ˈɪnʌndeɪt]

v. 淹没，泛滥

象形助记

v. 淹没，泛滥
The city was inundated by heavy rainfall, and was close to flooding.
这座城市被强降雨淹没，都快洪水泛滥了。

07 leeway [ˈliː.weɪ]

n.余地;[海][空]风压差

词根助记
lee保护+way道路→自保的路→leeway余地

n.余地
We don’t have enough leeway to pass them safely.
我们没有足够的余地来让这些船安全通过。

08 remark [rɪˈmɑːk $ -ˈmɑːrk]

v.注意；议论；评论；n.评论；谈论；话语，话；备注；言论；意见

词根助记
re再+mark记号，符号→再做记号→remark注意

v. 注意
I remarked the safety notice on the fence.
我注意到了围栏上的安全须知。

., remarking on the pretty blue-green light they gave off.
注意它们发出的蓝绿色的光。
来源：剑9 Test4 阅读

09 flourish [ˈflʌr.ɪʃ $ ˈflɝː-]

vi.繁荣，兴旺；茂盛；vt.夸耀；n.兴旺；茂盛；炫耀；华丽的词藻

词根助记
flour（音同flower）花+ish使成为，表动词→开花→flourish繁荣，兴旺

vi. 繁荣，兴旺
This place is flourishing with each passing day.
这个地方一天比一天繁荣。

The Harappan Civilisation of ancient Pakistan and India flourished 5,000 years ago,28
古巴基斯坦和印度的哈拉帕文明在5000年前繁荣昌盛
来源：剑13 Test3 阅读

vi. 茂盛
They flourish in warm, sunny climates…
它们在温暖、阳光充足的气候中成长茂盛….
来源：剑12 Test5 阅读

10 purge [pɜːdʒ $ pɝːdʒ]

v.通便，净化，使（身，心）清净；n.驱赶，泻药，净化

v. 通便，净化，使（身，心）清净
We will purge our files by recycling those we don’t need.
我们将通过回收那些我们不需要的东西来清理我们的文件。

tags.tag: 百词斩, 单词, 学习

entry.title: 考研词汇精选-058
entry.content:
01 appeal [əˈpiːl]

v.有吸引力；请求；上诉；呼吁；诉诸；启发，激发；n.吸引力；呼吁；请求；金筹款努力；上诉

词根助记
ap=ad去，向+ peal促使，推进→去促使，推进→appeal呼吁；有吸引力

v.有吸引力
The boy appeals to the girl a lot.
这个男孩对这个女孩很有吸引力。

It appealed to young people who were keen to improve their physical fitness.
它吸引了热衷于提高身体健康水平的年轻人。
来源：剑13 Test2 阅读

n.吸引力
The universal appeal of these tales is frequently attributed to the idea ..
这些故事的普遍吸引力往往归因于这样的想法…
来源：剑15 Test3 阅读

02 pose [pəʊz $ poʊz]

vt.引起，导致，造成；主张，提出；假扮，冒充；n.姿势；装腔作势，伪装；vi. 摆造型

词根助记
pos放+e→摆放造型→ pose姿势

vt.引起，导致，造成
Rapid industrial development has posed a threat to environment.
工业的快速发展对环境造成了威胁。

Steam ships posed a growing threat to clippers, as their speed and cargo capacity increased.
随着蒸汽船的速度和载货能力的提高，它们对快船造成的威胁越来越大。
来源：剑13 Test4 阅读

03 spur [spɜːr $ spɝː]

v.推动；激励，鞭策；策马，用踢马刺的方式驱马前进；n.踢马刺，靴刺；刺激，鞭策，鼓励；尖坡

象形助记

v. 推动
My friends’ encouragements spurred me to do my best.
朋友们的鼓励推动我做的更好。

These prices, coupled with the increasing demand, spurred the search for new routes to Asia ..
这些价格加上日益增长的需求，促使了对通往亚洲的新航线的寻找…….
来源：剑13 Test2 阅读

v. 激励，鞭策
… to spur managers to think more expansively about how trends could engender new value propositions in their core markets, ..
…为了激励管理者更广泛地思考“趋势”如何在其核心市场中产生新的价值主张,
来源：剑13 Test2 阅读

04 sultry [ˈsʌl.tri]

adj. 闷热的；迷人的;撩人的;风情万种的

象形助记

adj. 闷热的
I feel so uncomfortable in this sultry heat.
我在这闷热的天气里觉得不舒服。

05 conclude [kənˈkluːd]

v.推断出；使结束，终止；达成协议；断定;【化】得出(结论）；【数】推断

词根助记
con共同+ clude关闭→全部关闭→ conclude结束，总结；推断出

v. 推断出
The doctor concluded that she was not seriously ill, but just caught a cold.
医生推断她没什么大病，只是感冒了而已。

The survey concluded that one-fifth or 20 % of the household transport requirement as outside the local area.
调查得出的结论是，五分之一或20%的家庭交通需求是在当地以外的地方。
来源：剑7 Test2 阅读

06 dilemma [daɪˈlem.ə]

n.困境；进退两难的窘境;【财】困境，进退两难的局面

词根助记
di两个，双+lemma争论→二种争论→dilemma进退两难的窘境

n.困境
The man is faced with a moral dilemma.
这个男人面临进退两难的道德困境。

… the dilemmas that this new world raises regarding expertise, occupational boundaries, and control.
.这个新世界在专业知识、职业界限和控制方面引起的困境。
来源：剑16 Test1 阅读

07 estate [ɪˈsteɪt]

n.庄园；地产；住宅;(面上有大片建筑物的）土地；个人财产，遗产；工业区；住宅区

词根助记
e出 + stat站着+ e强调→站出来的东西→estate房子等不动产

n.庄园
She lives in a castle on an estate in London.
她住在伦敦一处庄园的城堡里。

Henderson rarely visited the area around Press estate when he wasyounger.
亨德森年轻时很少去普雷斯庄园附近的地区。
来源：剑14 Test2 阅读

08 cope [kəʊp $ koʊp]

vi.处理，应对；对抗；n.长袍；斗篷状覆盖物；墙帽；v.给..盖墙压顶

谐音助记
cope谐音：靠谱；“处理”事情需要靠谱的人。

vi.处理，应对
The experienced captain can cope with the dangerous situation and find a solution.
这位经验丰富的机长能应付危险情况并找到解决方法。

Vets are failing to cope with some aspects of animal health.
兽医难以应对有关动物健康方面的某些问题。
来源：剑17 Test1 听力

09 communal [ˈkɒm.jʊ.nəl $ kəˈmjuː- $ ˈkɑː.mjə-]

adj. 公共的；公社的

象形助记

adj. 公共的
They are studying at the communal area of that library.
他们正在图书馆的公共区域学习。

…the Babylonians began to measure time, introducing calendars to co-ordinate communal activities…
巴比伦人开始测量时间，引入日历来协调公共活动.
来源：剑8 Test1 阅读

10 censorship [ˈsent.sə.ʃɪp $ -sɚ-]

n.审查制度；审查机构

词根助记
censor审查+ ship表名词→censorship审查机构，审查制度

n.审查制度
A part of this image is blurred because of censorship guidelines.
因为审查制度，这幅图像的一部分被模糊了。

tags.tag: 百词斩, 单词, 学习

entry.title: 考研词汇精选-057
entry.content:
01 repeal [rɪˈpiːl]

n.撤销；v.废除；废止;【财】废除

词根助记
re向后，往回+peal呼叫→引申词义repeal撤销

n.撤销
The repeal of the Affordable Care Act has been decided by Congress.
国会决定撤销《平价医疗法案》。

In Britain, the modern glass industry only really started to develop after the repeal of the Excise Act in 1845.
在英国，现代玻璃工业是在1845年《消费税法案》废除后才真正开始发展的。
来源：剑12 Test8 阅读

02 admission [ədˈmɪʃ.ən]

n.入场费；准许进入；进入权；承认

词根助记
admiss=admit承认+ion名词后缀→admission准许进入，引申为”入场费”

n.入场费
The admission to the rock music concert is expensive.
摇滚音乐会的入场费很贵。

Do you think the advantages of charging people for admission to museums outweigh the disadvantages?
你认为收取博物馆门票的利大于弊吗?
来源：剑10 Test4 写作

03 mob [mɒb $ mɑːb]

(指民众）包围 (为攻击或赞赏) ；n.（尤指）暴民

谐音助记
mob 谐音：冒搏；冒失还喜欢”包围”搏斗的人，难道不是”暴民”吗？

(指民众）包围 (为攻击或赞赏)
The star was mobbed by the fans as soon as she came back.
这个明星一复出就被粉丝包围。

04 onus [ˈəʊnəs]

n.义务，责任，负担;【财】责任，义务(the~)

象形助记

n.义务，责任，负担
No-one else is going to process these expense reports, so I guess the onus is on me.
没人会处理这些开支报告，所以我想责任就落在了我身上。

05 elusive [ɪˈluː.sɪv]

adj.难捉摸的；难以表述的；难以获得的；难记的

词根助记
e出+lus玩，戏剧+ive形容词后缀→把人玩出去→让人难懂的

adj.难捉摸的
The escaped prisoner is very elusive and has never been found.
这个逃犯非常难捉，他一直没有被发现。

Smell, however, is a highly elusive phenomenon.
然而，气味是非常难以捉摸的。
来源：剑8 Test2 阅读

06 repatriate [ˌriːˈpætrieɪt]

v. 遣返；n.被遣返回国者

象形助记

v. 遣返
The government repatriated him because he had no visa.
因为他没有签证，政府将他遣返。

07 disdain [dɪsˈdeɪn]

n.蔑视，鄙视；vt.鄙视；不屑

词根助记
dis 不+ dain 高贵→不高贵→蔑视，鄙视，看不起

n.蔑视，鄙视
Her facial expression shows her disdain for the girl beside her.
她的表情表明了她很鄙视她旁边的女生。

08 native [ˈneɪ.təʊ $ -t̬oʊ]

adj.当地土产的；本地的；土著的；母语的；与生俱来的；本国的；出生地的;【计】本地的；n.本地人；土著；当地动植物

词根助记
nat出生+ive名词后缀→在本地出生的→ native当地土产的

adj.当地土产的
The star fruit is native to tropical Southeast Asia.
杨桃原产于热带东南亚。

The nutmeg tree, Myristica fragrans, is a large evergreen tree native to Southeast Asia.
肉豆蔻树（Myristica fragrans）是原产于东南亚的一种大型常青树。
来源：剑15 Test1 阅读

adj.本地的
Whereas the region’s native evergreen pines shade the snow and absorb radiation,…
尽管该地区本土的常绿松树遮蔽了雪并吸收了辐射，
来源：剑11 Test1 阅读

adj.土著的
The islands’ native inhabitants called this land mass Aleyska, the ‘Great Land’
这些岛屿的原住民称这块土地为阿利斯卡，即”伟大的土地…
来源：剑7 Test4 阅读

09 bargain [ˈbɑː.ɡɪn $ ˈbɑːr-]

v.讨价还价；经讨价还价成交；谈判；议价，讨价还价；n.交易；便宜货；契约

联想助记
bargain谐音：白给；白给你算了，“便宜货”还要”讨价还价”。

v. 讨价还价
The lady is trying to bargain with the seller.
这位女士试图和卖方砍价。

10 rear [rɪər $ rɪr]

v.抚养；举起；adj. 背面的；n.后部

联想助记
他的耳朵（ear）“后部”（rear）长了个东西。

v. 抚养
She reared a family of four on her own.
她一个人养活四个孩子。

… she persuaded her husband to allow her to rear silkworms on a grove of mulberry trees.
…她说服丈夫允许她在一片桑树林里养蚕。
来源：剑11 Test3 阅读

adj. 背面的
.., the yacht’s helicopter has a rear double door and a large internal space that’s well suited for cargo, …
游艇的直升机有一个后部双扇门和一个很适合装载货物的大内部空间，.．．..
来源：剑12 Test7 阅读

n. 后部
Its most distinguishing feature was the 13- 19 dark brown stripes over its back, beginning at the rear of the body and extending onto the tail.
它最明显的特征是背部有13-19条深棕色的条纹，从身体的后部开始一直延伸到尾巴。
来源：剑17 Test3 阅读

tags.tag: 百词斩, 单词, 学习

entry.title: 考研词汇精选-056
entry.content:
01 overdue [ˌəʊ.vəˈdjuː $ ˌoʊ.vɚˈduː]

adj.过期的；迟到的；未兑的;【财】延误，过期

象形助记

adj. 过期的
The boy needs to pay the fine on his overdue book.
这男孩需要为过期未还的书支付罚款。

02 plight [plaɪt]

n.困境；v.宣誓，保证

联想助记
p.（扑灭）+light（光亮）=扑灭了前进的光亮，即扑灭了希望，陷入“困境”

n.困境
Drifting on the sea for days without rescue, he fell into a desperate plight.
在海上漂流好几天后仍未获救，他陷入了绝望的困境。

03 ammunition [ˌæmjuˈnɪʃn]

n.弹药；炮弹

象形助记

n.弹药
The soldier is well equipped with ammunition.
这个士兵装备好了弹药。

04 entitle [ɪnˈtaɪtl]

v.给予….权利；给（书）题名；授予….头衔；使符合资格

词根助记
en=in在里面+title名称→在里面给名称→entitle给…题名；给予权利

v.给予..权利
Everyone’s entitled to their own opinion.
人人都有权发表自己的意见。

… only royalty were entitled to have clothes made of silk.
.只有皇室成员才有权拥有丝绸制成的衣服。
来源：剑11 Test3 阅读

05 augment [ɒsˈtreɪ.li.ən $ ɑːˈstreɪl.jən]

v.增加；助长

词根助记
aug增加+ment行为或结果→augment增强

v.增加
The company decided to augment its workforce to meet the increasing demand for its products.
公司决定增加员工数量，满足产品日益增长的需求。

Tesco has not abandoned its traditional retail offerings but augmented its business with these innovations, …
特易购并没有放弃传统的零售业务，而是用这些创新扩大了业务，..
来源：剑13 Test2 阅读

06 nuisance [ˈnjuː.sənts $ ˈnuː-]

n.麻烦事；讨厌的人；伤害;【法】妨害

词根助记
nui伤害+ s+ ance表名词→ nuisance讨厌的人，麻烦事

n.麻烦事
It’s such a nuisance that ants climb on my cupcake.
蚂蚁爬上了我的蛋糕，真是件麻烦事儿！

…another dangerous weed, which has become a nuisance in many parts of the world.
.另一种危险的杂草，在世界上许多地方已经成为一种滋扰。
来源：剑8 Test4 阅读

07 shed [ˌsaɪ.ə.miːzˈtwɪnz]

v. 把光照到（或洒在）.上；脱落；流出（眼泪）；蜕皮；流下；摆脱；把光照到；n.棚屋；简易房

谐音助记
shed”晒得”：太阳晒得使整个视野都变得清晰 (shed）起来

v.把光照到（或洒在）…..上
The candles shed a soft glow on the table.
蜡烛在桌面投下一道柔光。

New research sheds light on the disappearance of an ancient society…
新的研究揭示了古代社会消失的原因…
来源：剑13 Test3 阅读

v. 脱落
These may be ingredients used in cosmetics and toiletries, fibers shed by synthetic clothing in the wash…
这些可能是化妆品和洗漱用品中使用的成分，在洗涤过程中合成衣物脱落的纤维
来源：剑14 Test4 阅读

08 opponent [əˈpəʊ.nənt $ -ˈpoʊ-]

n.对手，敌手，对抗者；竞争者；adj. 对立的；敌对的

词根助记
op反+ pon放置+ent表名词，“人.”→反着的→opponent对手，敌手，对抗者

n.对手，敌手，对抗者
The boxer punched his opponent severely!
这个拳击手痛击对手！

He misunderstood the motives of his opponents.
他误解了对手的动机。
来源：剑17 Test1 阅读

09

n.兽群，牧群；v. 放牧，群集

象形助记

n.兽群，牧群
Look! There is a herd of sheep!
看！这有一群羊！

That circuit evolved from a very simple mechanism for decoding basic information, like the number of goats in one’s herd, to…
这个回路从一个非常简单的解码基本信息的机制进化而来，比如一个人的羊群里有多少只山羊，到….
来源：剑16 Test4 阅读

10 doom [duːm]

vt.注定，使在劫难逃；判定；n.毁灭；厄运，劫数；宣告，判决

象形助记

vt. 注定，使在劫难逃
One bad move doomed him to failure in the chess competition.
走错的那一步棋注定了他在比赛中的失败。

They would have prevented the reseeding of the slow-growing palm trees and thereby doomed Rapa Nui’s forest, …
他们会阻止重新播种生长缓慢的棕榈树，从而让拉帕努伊岛的森林在劫难逃,
来源：剑11 Test2 阅读

tags.tag: 百词斩, 单词, 学习

entry.title: 考研词汇精选-055
entry.content:
01 pungent [ˈpʌn.dʒənt]

adj. 刺鼻的；刺激性的；尖锐的

象形助记

adj. 刺鼻的
Onions are so pungent that they make me tear up.
洋葱太刺鼻了，我都要流泪了。

02 fend [ˈfent.sɪŋ]

（靠自己）照顾，照料；保护；力争

联想助记
fend缩写自defend，挡开→挡开别人的攻击→（靠自己）照顾，照料

v.（靠自己）照顾，照料
The baby can fend for himself well.
这个宝宝可以很好地照顾自己。

03 vengeance [ˈven.dʒənts]

n.复仇，报仇

象形助记

n.复仇，报仇
The cat decides to take vengeance on its friend.
这只猫决定报复它的朋友。

04 turbine [ˈtɜː.baɪn $ ˈtɝː-]

n.汽轮机，叶轮机;【物】涡轮

词根助记
turb搅动+ine表名词→turbine汽轮机，叶轮机

n.汽轮机，叶轮机
These wind turbines can generate electricity.
这些风力涡轮机能发电。

These can cause vibration and damage the blades of the turbines.
这些会引起振动并损坏涡轮机的叶片。
来源：剑9 Test3 阅读

05 topple [ˈtɒpl]

v.推翻，颠覆;(使）倒塌

联想助记
苹果（apple）在顶上（top）“摇摇欲坠”(topple)

v.推翻，颠覆;(使）倒塌
The boy lost balance and the great pile of books toppled over.
那个男孩失去了平衡，一大堆书倒了下来。

When the wood was gone and civil war began, the islanders began toppling the moai.
当木材耗尽，内战爆发时，岛民们开始推倒摩埃石像。
来源：剑11 Test2 阅读

06 lid [lɪd]

n.盖，盖子;【化】盖子，封闭装置

联想助记
他的嘴唇（lip）磕到了盖子（lid）上。

n.盖，盖子
My mouth watered when the waiter took the lid off the plate.
当服务员把盘子上的盖子拿起来时，我流口水了。

The shafts were … covered with a wooden or stone lid.
竖井会….盖着木头或石头做的盖子。
来源：剑16 Test4 阅读

07 dissolve [dɪˈzɒlv $ -ˈzɑːlv]

v. (使）溶解;(使）解散；消除，(使)消失；【化】溶解，分解

词根助记
dis分开，分离+ solve解决，溶解→完全分散→dissolve溶解

v. (使）溶解
This tablet dissolves in water.
这片药在水中会溶解。

08 parcel [ˈpɑː.səl $ ˈpɑːr-]

n.包裹；一片地，一块地；v.打包，裹好

词根助记
par部分+ cel表名词→小包裹→parcel包裹

n.包裹
“I have some parcels for you” said the mailman.
“有您的一些包裹。”邮递员说道。

09 scandal [ˈskæn.dəl]

n. 丑闻；丢脸；流言语；反感；愤慨;【财】丑闻；v. 低毁

联想助记
scan浏览+ dal大量=我在网上浏览了大量的”丑闻”(scandal)

n.丑闻
Mr. Giraffe was involved in the academic scandal and received widespread media coverage.
长颈鹿先生卷入了学术丑闻，并受到了媒体的广泛关注。

10 myriad [ˈmɪriəd]

n.无数；极大数量；adj.无数的

词根助记
myri表示”一万，无数”+ ad表名词，“..东西，状态”，有集合的含义→myriad无数

n.无数
There is a myriad of flowers.
这里有无数的花朵。

tags.tag: 百词斩, 单词, 学习

entry.title: 考研词汇精选-054
entry.content:
01 harness [ˈhɑːnɪs]

n.挽具，马具；降落伞背带；牵引绳；vt.治理（河流等）；上挽具；利用；【财】治理

词根助记
har军队+ ness供给，供应→提供给士兵的→harness保护带；挽具

n.挽具，马具
A harness is fastened around the horse’s head and body.
一套马具绑在马的头上和身上。

02 wrestle [ˈres.l̩]

v.努力斗争；摔跤，角斗；奋力对付；n.摔跤，角力，扭斗

象形助记

v. 努力斗争
He had to wrestle with his conscience before making the difficult decision.
在做出艰难的决定之前，他不得不与自己的良心作斗争。

. spent decades wrestling with the enigma of the Industrial Revolution.
花了几十年的时间与工业革命之谜做斗争。
来源：剑10Test2 阅读

03 nibble [ˈnɪbl]

V.一点点地咬，慢慢啃，吹毛求疵；n.细咬，轻咬，啃

象形助记

v. 一点点地咬，慢慢啃，吹毛求疵
The bulldog puppy is nibbling on the toy.
那只小斗牛犬在咬玩具。

04 conceal [kənˈsiːl]

v.隐藏，隐瞒，掩盖;【财】隐瞒

词根助记
con加强+ceal隐藏→conceal隐藏，隐瞒

v.隐藏，隐瞒，掩盖
I use this mask to conceal my face.
我用面具来隐藏我的脸。

.. concealed inside hollow bamboo walking canes.
.隐藏在空心竹制手杖内。
来源：剑11 Test3 阅读

05 weld [strong wiːl]

v. 焊接;使结合，使成整体；n.焊接

象形助记

v.焊接
He is welding together the two pieces of metal.
他正在把两片金属焊接在一起。

… the steel sections were bolted rather than welded together.
…钢材部分采用螺栓连接而不是焊接在一起。
来源：剑11 Test1 阅读

06 perch [pɜːtʃ $ pɝːtʃ]

n.河鲈；栖木；有利的地位；杆(使）栖息，就位

n.河鲈
I caught a perch while fishing at the lake yesterday.
昨天我在湖边钓鱼时钓到了一条鲈鱼。

… and well over a million tonnes of groundfish (cod, sole, perch and pollock) in 2000.
..以及2000年超过100万吨的底栖鱼类（鳕鱼、鳎鱼、鲈鱼和鳕鱼)
来源：剑7 Test4 阅读

07 tolerance [ˈtɒlərəns]

n.忍耐力;（动植物对药物或毒药的）耐受性；容忍，宽恕

词根助记
toler容忍+ ance表示状态、情况、性质、行为→tolerance忍受，容忍

n.忍耐力
I’ve had to develop a tolerance for loud noise at home.
我不得不在家养成耐受巨大噪声的能力。

… they might attract fruit-eating birds or increase a leaf’s tolerance to freezing.
它们可能会吸引吃水果的鸟，或者增加叶子对冰冻的耐受性。
来源：剑10 Test3 阅读

n. (动植物对药物或毒药的）耐受性
Reading Yong’s book is in many ways a plea for microbial tolerance, ..
从很多方面来说，阅读Yong的书是对微生物耐受性的呼吁，
来源：剑16 Test2 阅读

08 density [ˈdent.sɪ.ti $ -sə.t̬i]

n.密度；密集，稠密;【化】密度;【物】密度

词根助记
dens稠密的+ ity名词后缀表性质→稠密→ density稠度，密度

n.密度
The high density of buildings makes the city so crowded.
这个城市的建筑密度很高，所以城市也非常拥挤。

This is a disease where bones show reduced density, usually caused by insufficient exercise, reduced calcium intake, or food starvation.
这是一种骨质密度降低的疾病，通常是由于运动不足、钙摄入量减少或食物饥饿引起的。
来源：剑16 Test1 阅读

09 insipid [ɪnˈsɪpɪd]

adj.淡而无味的；枯燥乏味的

象形助记

adj.淡而无味的
She is disappointed with her breakfast. It’s so insipid!
她对早饭失望至极。太清淡了！

10

n.格式；总体安排；版式；设计；v.设计一个版式，设计….的版面；使格式化

词根助记
form形式+at（e）→东西的形式→format格式

n.格式
Different files have different formats.
不同的文件有不同的格式。

The content and format of explanations dated back to a time when …
解释的内容和形式可以追溯到.····
来源：剑9 Test4 阅读

n.总体安排
The typical format of a maths lesson ..
典型的数学课安排设计..
来源：剑8 Test4 阅读

tags.tag: 百词斩, 单词, 学习

entry.title: 考研词汇精选-053
entry.content:
01 ritual [ˈrɪt.ju.əl $ ˈrɪtʃ.u-]

n.（宗教等的）仪式，例行公事;（宗教等的）仪式；adj.作为仪式一部分的，例行的

词根助记
rit=rite仪式+ual表形容词→ritual仪式的

n（宗教等的）仪式，例行公事
In some cultures, the ritual of baptism is practiced.
在一些文化中，人们有出生洗礼的仪式。

Such rituals may be seen as placebos.
这样的仪式可能被视为安慰措施。
来源：剑7 Test1 阅读

adj.作为仪式一部分的，例行的
Streets went uncleaned, buildings started to be abandoned, and ritual structures fell out of use.
街道没有打扫，建筑物开始被废弃，宗教仪式建筑也不再使用。
来源：剑13 Test3 阅读

02 rack [ræk]

n.挂架，搁架；v. 使痛苦

象形助记

n.挂架，搁架
We can use these racks to hang our clothes.
我们可以用这些架子来挂衣服。

sturdy white bikes locked in special racks which could be opened with the chip card …
坚固的白色自行车被锁在特殊的机架上，可以用芯片卡打开
来源：剑14 Test1 阅读

03 designate [ˈdezɪɡneɪt]

v.标明；标示；指明；指定，选定，委派，任命；指定，划定 (特征、用途)；adj．已受委派而尚未上任的

词根助记
de着重+sign记号，信号+ate动词后缀→着重做记号→designate指定

v.标明；标示；指明
These three road signs designate that we have to go another way.
这三个路标指明我们必须走另一条路。

Controlled airspace is divided into several different types, designated by letters of the alphabet.
管制空域分为几种不同的类型，通过字母表中的字母来标明。
来源：剑8 Test1 阅读

v.指定，选定，委派，任命
… the suggestopedic session be conducted exactly in the manner designated, by trained and accredited suggestopedic teachers.
.建议性会话应由经过培训和认证的建议性教师严格按照指定的方式进行。
来源：剑7 Test1 阅读

04 ripe [rɪp]

adj. 熟的，成熟的；时机成熟的
<诗〉同”ripen”

联想助记
庄稼变”成熟的”（ripe），就可以收获（reap）了。

adj.熟的，成熟的
When bananas become ripe, they turn yellow.
香蕉成熟的时候，颜色就会变黄。

When the fruit is ripe, this husk splits into two halves along a ridge running the length of the fruit.
当果实成熟时，这个外壳会沿着果实的长边分成两半。
来源：剑15Test1 阅读

05 endorse [ɪnˈdɔːs]

v.代言；赞同，认可；背书

词根助记
en进入，使+dors背十e→在背后签字，即背书→endorse赞同

v.代言
The celebrity is endorsing the brand’s lipstick.
这位名人正在为这个品牌的口红代言。

06 breach [briːtʃ]

n.裂痕；破裂；冲击；违反；v.使有裂口；破坏；违反，违背;【法】违背，破坏

联想助记
b（不）+reach（达到，完成）→没有完成，因为已经”违反”（breach）了规则。

n.裂痕
The situation became very dangerous because of the breach in the dam.
由于大坝出现裂口，形势变得非常危险。

07 crook [krʊk]

n.弯曲处；骗子，罪犯；钩；河弯；诡计；v. 使弯曲；adj 不正当的；骗人的

象形助记

n.弯曲处
The sad girl hid her face in the crook of her arms.
那个悲伤的女孩把脸埋在臂弯里。

08 supreme [suːˈpriːm]

adj 最重要的;至高的；极度的

象形助记

adj.最重要的
Punctuality is considered the supreme principle in this company.
守时被认为是这家公司最重要的原则。

Why does chlorophyll need protection when it is the natural world’s supreme light absorber?
为什么叶绿素是自然界中最重要的光吸收剂还需要保护？
来源：剑10 Test3 阅读

09 surge [sɜːdʒ]

n.激增；波涛汹涌；波动；vi.汹涌；激增

词根助记
sur从下往上+ ge笔直地→从下往上笔直地上涨→surge激增

n.激增
In recent years, there has been a surge in population growth in many cities.
近年来，许多城市的人口增长激增。

Reed credits Thomas Bouchard’s work for today’s surge in twin studies.
里德将今天双胞胎研究的激增归功于托马斯·布沙尔的工作。
来源：剑11 Test4 阅读

10 hubbub [ˌaɪ.siː.biːˈem]

n.嘈杂，喧哗

象形助记

n.嘈杂，喧哗
He can not hear his friend over the hubbub of the crowd.
在人群的喧哗中，他听不见他朋友说话。

tags.tag: 百词斩, 单词, 学习

entry.title: 考研词汇精选-052
entry.content:
01 riotous [ˈraɪ.ə.təs $ -t̬əs]

adj.狂欢的；暴乱的；放荡的；茂盛的

词根助记
riot暴乱+ous形容词后缀→riotous狂欢的

adj. 狂欢的
We went to a riotous party and danced all night.
我们参加了一场狂欢派对，跳了一整夜的舞。

02 nasty [ˈnɑː.sti $ ˈnæs.ti]

adj.令人讨厌的；严重的；恶劣的；下流的；令人厌恶的，令人不悦的；不友善的，恶意的；难吃的；n（复数形式）令人不愉快或对人有害的事物

词根助记
nast脏的+ y表形容词→ nasty令人讨厌的

adj. 令人讨厌的
The shoe smells nasty.
这鞋的味道令人讨厌。

A lot of very nasty things happen to truly ‘wild ‘ animals that simply don’t happen in good zoos …
很多非常令人讨厌的的事情发生在真正的”野生”动物身上，而这些事情在好的动物园里根本不会发生.
来源：剑14 Test4 阅读

03 obsession [əbˈseʃn]

n.着迷；着魔

词根助记
obsess使着迷+ion名词后缀→obsession着迷

n.着迷
His obsession with cars is obvious.
他对汽车的痴迷显而易见。

New research suggests that this obsession with efficiency is misguided.
新的研究表明，这种对效率的痴迷被误导了。
来源：剑14 Test2 阅读

04 hypocrisy [ˌaɪ.siː.biːˈem]

n.伪善；虚伪

词根助记
hypo 欠缺+ cris 评论，观点+y名词后缀→掩饰真实情感的→hypocrisy伪善，虚伪

n.伪善
This worker’s hypocrisy even made him dump trash in the ocean after collecting it.
这个工人很伪善，他收集完垃圾后竟然朝海里倒。

05 quaint [kweɪnt]

adj 古雅的；精巧的

谐音助记
quaint谐音：亏他～多亏了他一时兴起的古怪念头，才让我们找到了这座古色古香的建筑。

adj.古雅的
What a quaint town with its narrow streets and old-fashioned houses!
这真是一个古雅的小镇啊！有着狭窄的街道和老式的房屋。

06 mustard [ˈmʌstəd]

n.芥菜；芥末；芥末色；adj 芥末色的

n.芥菜
Many people like to eat pickled mustard.
许多人喜欢吃腌制过的芥菜。

… using a mustard plant called Arabidopsis, ..
…用一种叫拟南芥的芥菜，
来源：剑16 Test3 阅读

07 persevere [ˌpɜːsɪˈvɪə(r)]

vi. 坚持，不屈不挠；孜孜以求

词根助记
per始终+ severe严肃→对自己的目标始终严肃→persevere坚持不懈

vi. 坚持，不屈不挠
Despite a number of failures, he persevered with his experiments.
虽屡遭挫败，他仍然坚持做实验。

08 exclamation [ˌekskləˈmeɪʃn]

n.感叹，惊呼；惊叹词

词根助记
ex向外+ clam呼喊+ ation名词后缀→喊出来的话→exclaimation感叹

n.感叹，惊呼
The author used three exclamation marks to express his anger.
作者用了三个感叹号来表达他的愤怒。

09 delicate [ˈdel.ɪ.kət]

adj.易碎的，脆弱的；微妙的，需要谨慎处理的；（人）娇弱的，体弱多病的；精美的，精致的；优美的，优雅的；淡雅的；纤细的，细长的

谐音助记
delicate谐音：得离开点儿
那个东西非常“易碎”，我们得离开点儿。

adj.易碎的，脆弱的
The vase is delicate and should be packed with care.
花瓶易碎，应小心打包。

… provide additional cushioning for the hull’s delicate timber framework.
…为船体脆弱的木材框架提供额外的缓冲。
来源：剑10 Test1 阅读

adj. 微妙的，需要谨慎处理的
Managers must learn how to achieve the delicate balance of .
管理者必须学会如何实现微妙的平衡…
来源：剑11 Test2 阅读

10 tremendous [trɪˈmen.dəs]

adj．巨大的；精彩的，出色的；惊人的；极大的

词根助记
trem颤抖+end尽头+ous形容词后缀→让人颤抖的→tremendous巨大的

adj．巨大的
I feel the tremendous pressure of car and house loans on my shoulders.
我感觉肩上扛着巨大的车贷和房贷压力。

Because of their tremendous breeding potential and genetic diversity, many pests are known to withstand synthetic chemicals …
由于其巨大的育种潜力和遗传多样性，许多害虫都能抵御合成化学品..
来源：剑8 Test4 阅读

tags.tag: 百词斩, 单词, 学习

entry.title: 考研词汇精选-051
entry.content:
01 endure [ɪnˈdjʊə(r)]

v.持久，持续；忍受，容忍

词根助记
en进入，使+ dur=last,hard持久，坚持→endure持久，持续

v.持久，持续
Their love has endured for many years.
他们的感情持续多年。

It was Pasteur’s’germ theory’ that gave bacteria the poor image that endures today.
正是巴斯德的“细菌理论”给细菌留下了持续至今天的糟糕形象。
来源：剑16 Test2 阅读

02 rascal [ˈrɑː.skəl $ ˈræs.kəl]

n.坏蛋，淘气鬼；不诚实的人

词根助记
ras=scrape刮擦+ al人，物→刮下来的垃圾→rascal坏蛋

n.坏蛋，淘气鬼
The three rascals are playing slingshot at cornfields now.
那三个淘气鬼正在玉米田里玩弹弓。

03 impromptu [ɪmˈprɒmptjuː]

adj 即席的，即兴的；一触即发的；adv.即席，即兴；n.即兴之作

词根助记
im无，非+promptu,准备好的，立即的→没有准备好的→impromptu一触即发的；即兴的

adj.即席的，即兴的
He composed an impromptu poem within seven paces.
他在七步之内即兴作了首诗。

04 crude [kruːd]

adj.粗糙的；天然的；粗鲁的；简陋的；粗略的，大概的；n.原油

词根助记
crud生的+e→crude粗糙的；原始的

adj 粗糙的
The primitive man could use crude stone tools.
原始人会使用粗糙的石器。

It is an astonishingly crude and simple-minded way of thinking …
这是一种惊人的粗糙和简单的思维方式
来源：剑13 Test4 阅读

05 bristle [ˈbrɪs.l̩]

v. 发怒；竖起；n.猪鬃；刚毛

联想助记
不要吹口哨（whistle）了，这会让他”发怒”(bristle)

v. 发怒
The man bristled with the phone call
这个人对这通电话大为恼怒。

06 lodging [ˈlɒdʒ.ɪŋ $ ˈlɑː.dʒɪŋ]

n.租住的房间；寄宿，借宿；（大学生的）校外宿舍

词根助记
lodg寄宿+ing表示行为、状态、情况→lodging寄宿，借宿

n.租住的房间
You can find all kinds of lodgings available on this website.
你可以在这个网站上找到各种各样的出租房间。

07 consciousness [ˈkɒn.tʃə.snəs $ ˈkɑːn-]

n.意识，知觉；思想；【护】意识状态

词根助记
con加强意义 +sci知道+ ous 形容词词尾+ ness 名词词尾→consciousness意识，知觉

n.意识，知觉
His consciousness was clouded by the pain.
疼痛使他的意识变得模糊。

In suggestopedia, as he called his method, consciousness is shifted away from the curriculum to focus on something peripheral.
在他所谓的”暗示教学法”中，意识从课程中转移到外围事物上。
来源：剑7 Test1 阅读

08 defy [dɪˈfaɪ]

v. 违背；违抗，藐视；使不可能(理解或解释)；赌…也不能

联想助记
他否认（deny）“违背”（defy）了规定。

v. 违背
Many people defied the warning sign of no scribbling on the wall.
许多人不顾墙上不准乱涂乱画的警告标志。

09 rigid [ˈrɪdʒ.ɪd]

adj.死板的；坚硬的；僵硬的；固执的；严格的

象形助记

adj.死板的
The restaurant rules are rigid.
这家餐馆的规定很死板。

.. in order to reduce the organisation’s rigid hierarchies.
.·….为了减少组织中僵化的等级制度。
来源：剑14 Test2 阅读

10 nobility [nəʊˈbɪl.ə.ti $ noʊˈbɪl.ə.t̬i]

n.贵族；高贵；高尚；高尚的精神

词根助记
nobl(e)高贵的，贵族的+ility名词后缀→nobility贵族

n.贵族
Look at their outfits! They must belong to the nobility.
看看他们的服装！他们一定是贵族。

.., home tutoring was common in the families of the nobility and wealthy, ..
·．…在美国，家庭辅导在贵族和富人家庭中很常见，
来源：剑8 Test3 阅读

tags.tag: 百词斩, 单词, 学习

entry.title: 考研词汇精选-050
entry.content:
01 commonly [ˈkɒm.ən.li $ ˈkɑː.mən-]

adv.通常地；一般地；普通地

词根助记
common普遍的+ly副词后缀→commonly通常地

It commonly rains in London.
伦敦通常都是雨天。

The pitfall trap is another commonly used tool for collecting ants.
诱捕器是另一个常用于收集蚂蚁的工具。
来源：剑8 Test4 阅读

02 trolley [ˈtrɒli]

n.触轮；电车；有轨电车；无轨电车；手推车；v. 搭乘；vi. 搭乘

象形助记

The trolley makes moving items easier.
触轮使移动物品变得更容易。

The idea was that as one end of the column rose, the base would roll across the ground on a trolley.
这一想法是，当柱子的一端上升时，底座会在一个触轮上滚过地面。
来源：剑7 Test4 阅读

03 incinerator [ɪnˈsɪnəreɪtə(r)]

n.焚化装置，焚化炉，焚尸炉；焚烧装置；焚烧炉

词根助记
in=inside向内，表加强语气十ciner=ashes灰十at(e)可构成动词十 or可构成名词→incinerator楚

Incinerators play an important role in the city.
焚化炉在城市中起到重要作用。

04 tinge [tɪndʒ]

v. 给..染色，轻微地影响；·着淡色于…；n.淡淡的（颜色、神色），轻微，少量

谐音助记
tinge谐音：听着
听着，我要给你点“颜色”瞧瞧。

The maple leaf was tinged red in autumn.
枫叶在秋天被染成红色。

05 wipe [waɪp]

v.消除，抹去；擦，拭，楷；擦去；n.湿巾

联想助记
老婆（wife）用湿巾（wipe）“抹去”（wipe）桌子上的污渍。

The woman is wiping the mirror with a rag.
这个女人正在用抹布擦拭镜子。

Will we last another two thousand years or will we wipe ourselves out?
我们会再坚持两千年还是会自我毁灭？
来源：剑9 Test1 阅读

06 clamor [ˈklæmi]

n.喧闹；强烈的要求；v.喧；强烈地要求

象形助记

The clamor of the road gave them a headache.
街道上的噪声使他们头疼。

07 linen [ˈlɪn.ɪn]

n.亚麻；床单；亚麻布

词根助记
lin=line表直线，线条+en后缀→linen亚麻，床单

The linen tablecloth is rough to the touch.
这些亚麻桌布摸起来很粗糙。

08 startle [ˈstɑːtl]

v.惊吓；吃惊；n.吃惊

词根助记
start开始+le表动词→突然开始动起来→startle

The explosion of firecrackers startled the chicken.
鞭炮的爆炸声把鸡吓了一跳。

09 capitulate [ˈkæps.lɒkˌkiː]

vi.有条件投降，认输，屈服，让步，停止抵抗

象形助记

Faced with such a heavyworkload,he had to capitulate to his boss.
面对如此大的工作量，他不得不向老板投降。

10 attractive [əˈtræktɪv]

adj(事物）有吸引力的，诱人的；有魅力的，性感的；引起兴趣的

词根助记
at加强+tract拉+ive…的→attract拉过来=吸引+ive…的→attractive有吸引力的

With such a low price, the hotel room is really attractive.
这个旅馆房间价格如此低廉，真的很吸引人。

Why is palm oil so attractive for manufacturers?
为什么棕榈油对制造商如此有吸引力？
来源：剑17 Test3 阅读

tags.tag: 百词斩, 单词, 学习

entry.title: 考研词汇精选-049
entry.content:
01 subsidize [ˈsʌb.sɪ.daɪz]

v.给予补助金

词根助记
subsid(y)补助金+ize动词后缀→subsidize给予补助金

The government subsidizes housing costs for those with low income.
政府为低收入者提供住房补贴。

02 liberal [ˈlɪb.ər.əl $ -rəl $ -ɚ-]

n.开明的人；自由主义者；adj. 慷慨的；心胸宽阔的；自由主义的；人文 (教育)的

词根助记
liber自由+al形容词后缀→liberal自由的

Our boss is a liberal who always listens to others.
我们的上司是个开明的人，他总是能听取别人的意见。

03 spectrum [ˈspek.trəm]

n.光谱；范围；系列

象形助记

If you pass light through a prism, you can see the entire visual spectrum.
如果你让光穿过棱镜，你会看到整个可见光谱。

He wanted his shows to appeal to audiences across the social spectrum.
他希望自己的节目能吸引社会各界的观众。
来源：剑10 Test3 阅读

… it is created by anthocyanins, water-soluble plant pigments reflecting the red to blue range of the visible spectrum.
它是由花青素产生的，花青素是一种水溶性植物色素，反映可见光谱红色至蓝色的范围。
来源：剑15 test2 阅读

04 dove [dʌv]

n.鸽子（读作/dnv/）；鸽派人物；v. 潜水 (dive的过去式)(读作/douv/)

The dove is an international symbol of peace.
鸽子在全世界都代表和平。

05 strait [streɪt]

n.海峡；窘迫

This important strait, which joins two seas, is called the Strait of Hormuz.
这条连接两大海域的重要海峡被称为霍尔木兹海峡。

06 severely [ˌsaɪ.ə.miːzˈtwɪnz]

adv.严重地，严厉地，激烈地

词根助记
severe严峻十ly….地→severely严重地；严厉地

“You are awful parents!”, our little daughter told us severely.
“你们是差劲的父母！”，小女儿严厉地告诉我们。

… animals getting entangled in trash, for example, or eating it and severely injuring themselves.
例如，动物被垃圾缠住，或者吃了垃圾后严重受伤。
来源：剑14 Test4 阅读

07 temperament [ˈtem.pər.ə.mənt $ -prə.mənt $ -pɚ.ə-]

n.气质，性格，喜怒无常

词根助记
temper脾气+ament表名词→脾气状态→temperament气质，性格，喜怒无常

The female painter had an artistic temperament.
这位女画家有艺术气质。

Despite the common name ‘tiger’, the thylacine had a shy, nervous temperament.
尽管有一个共同的名字：‘老虎’，但袋狼的性格却是害羞胆怯的。
来源：剑17 Test3 阅读

08 threshold [ˈθreʃ.həʊld $ -hoʊld]

n.界限，起点；门槛；开端；【计〗阈值

象形助记

The insured can make claims when their own losses exceed certain thresholds.
当他们自己的损失超过一定的界限时，被保险人可以提出索赔。

Was there a threshold level - a tipping point - that needed to be reached to affect economic performance?
是否有一个临界水平，且需要达到这个临界点才会影响经济状况?
来源：剑17 Test4 阅读

09 disuse [dɪˈsjuːs]

n.废止；v. 废止

词根助记
dis否定前缀十 use使用→不再用了，废弃→disuse废止

The bus has been in disuse for many years.
这辆公交车已经废弃多年了。

… major events such as the Olympic Games or the FIFA World Cup have notably fallen into disuse and disrepair.
奥运会或国际足联世界杯等重大活动都明显陷入了废止和失修状态。
来源：剑17 Test1 阅读

10 mass media

phr.传媒工具，新闻界；大众传播媒体；海量媒体数据；新闻界

词根助记
mass大众 十 media媒体→大众使用的媒介→mass media大众传播媒体

TV is one of the representatives of mass media.
电视是大众传媒的代表之一。

tags.tag: 百词斩, 单词, 学习

entry.title: 考研词汇精选-048
entry.content:
01 recital [rɪˈsaɪ.təl $ -t̬əl]

n.独奏，吟诵，演奏会

词根助记
recite背诵，吟诵，朗诵+al表名词→recital独奏，吟诵，演奏会

I went to watch a famous pianist’s recital last night.
昨晚我去看了一个著名音乐家的钢琴独奏会。

02 mitten [ˈmɪt.ən $ ˈmɪt̬-]

n. 连指手套

象形助记

These mittens really keep my hands warm in the winter.
这双连指手套让我的手在冬天保持温暖。

03 monologue [ˈmɒn.əl.ɒɡ $ ˈmɑː.nə.lɑːɡ]

n.独白，个人长篇演说

象形助记

The entire play was just a two-hour monologue by one person； it was so boring!
整个演出就是一个人长达两小时的独白，太无聊了。

04 dagger [ˈdæɡə(r)]

n.短剑，匕首；vt.用短剑（或匕首）刺

象形助记

The woman is holding a dagger with both of her hands.
这个女人双手握着一把匕首。

05 gaudy [ˈɡɔːdi]

adj.(服饰、装饰、文风等）华丽而俗气的；浮华的；过分显眼；n.华丽而俗气的廉价饰物

词根助记
gaud艳俗廉价的饰物+ y可构成名词，表性质→gaudy华丽而俗气的

The gaudy style is all the rage with the younger generation now.
这款花哨的风格目前在年轻人里非常流行。

06 utterance [ˈʌt.ər.ənts $ ˈʌ.t̬ɚ-]

n.表达；说出的话；说话方式

词根助记
utter说，讲十 ance可构成名词→utterance表达，说出的话

I can’t understand your utterance. Speak up!
我不明白你想表达什么。大声点！

07 outfit [ˈaʊt.treɪ]

n.装备，装束，全套服装；组织，团队；v. 提供装备

词根助记
out外+fit装备→outfit全套装备，套装

The singer’s fancy outfit added to his stage presence.
华丽服饰令歌手的舞台形象更加出众。

08 filthy [ˈfɪl.θi]

adj 肮脏的；猥亵的；vt. 使不洁

词根助记
filth肮脏十y可构成形容词→filthy肮脏的

None of the roommates liked to clean, so the place was always filthy.
这屋子里的人都不爱做清洁，所以这里总是很脏。

There are even more insects that are masters of exploiting filthy habitats, such as feces and carcasses.
还有更多的昆虫擅长利用肮脏的栖息地，比如粪便和尸体。
来源：剑14 Test3 阅读

09 phonetics [fəʊˈnet.ɪks $ foʊˈnet̬-]

n.语音学，发音学

象形助记

Phonetics is related to how we pronounce words.
语音学和单词的发音有关。

10 laden [ˈleɪ.dən]

adj. 装满的；负载的；苦恼的，沉重的

象形助记

The ship is laden with all kinds of products.
那个船装满了各种货物。

She returned laden with tea.
她满载着茶叶回来了。
来源：剑13 Test4 阅读

tags.tag: 百词斩, 单词, 学习

entry.title: 考研词汇精选-047
entry.content:
01 interpret [ɪnˈtɜːprɪt]

v.解释；口译；【计】解释；vt.把….理解（解释）为

词根助记
inter相互+pret表达→语言之间相互表达→interpret解释

The teacherhelped us interpret the graph.
老师帮助我们解读了这个图表。

It interprets data logically.
它对数据的解释是有逻辑性的。
来源：剑9 Test2 阅读

.., suggesting that the brain is remarkably flexible in its ability to interpret sounds as language.
这表明大脑在将声音理解为语言的能力方面具有显著的灵活性。
来源：剑15 Test4 阅读

02 yarn [jɑːn]

n.纱线；离奇故事；v.讲离奇故事

Here is a selection of colorful yarn.
这是一些彩色的纱线。

Wool became the most popular yarn for spinning.
羊毛成了最受欢迎的纺纱纱线。
来源：剑16 Test3 听力

03 preposition [ˌprep.əˈzɪʃ.ən]

n.前置词，介词

词根助记
pre..前的，预先+position位置→位置放在前面→前置词，介词

Prepositions are usually used before nouns to give additional information.
介词通常用在名词前来给出额外的信息。

04 fallacy [ˈfæləsi]

n.谬论，谬见；错误，谬误

象形助记

The idea that only women do housework is a fallacy.
“只有女人才做家务”是谬论。

On the subject of job losses, Low believes the predictions are founded on a fallacy.
在失业问题上，洛认为这些预测是建立在一个谬论的基础之上的。
来源：剑16 Test1 阅读

05 compulsory [kəmˈpʌl.sər.i $ -sɚ-]

adj.必修的；强制的，义务的

词根助记
com共同+puls驱动，推+ory…的→一起推动的→compulsory强制性的；必修的

English is a compulsory subject atschool.
英语是学校的一门必修课。

Maths is recognised as an important compulsory subject throughout schooling.
数学是学校里的必修课程。
来源：剑8 Test4 阅读

There is a compulsory f 9016 …fee for members.
会员需要支付9016欧元的强制费用。
来源：剑10 Test1 听力

06 ailment [ˈeɪl.mənt]

n.疾病（尤指微恙），不宁，不安

词根助记
ail （使）患病+ment表名词→ailment疾病（尤指微恙），不宁，不安

The woman appears to have a back ailment.
这个女人似乎有背部疾病。

Cinnamon was thought to cure various ailments, such as indigestion.
肉桂被认为可以治疗各种疾病，例如消化不良。
来源：剑13Test2阅读

07 impartial [ɪmˈpɑː.ʃəl $ -ˈpɑːr-]

adj.公平的，不偏不倚的；【财】公正的

A judgeshould guarantee that thetrial is impartial.
法官应该保证审判是公平的。

08 rig [rɪɡ]

v.操纵；装配；欺骗；n.钻井架；装备；帆具；成套器械

There are bad guys rigging the market.
有坏人在操纵市场。

But nobody has any idea what their canoes looked like or how they were rigged.
但没有人知道他们的独木舟长什么样，也不知道它们是如何被操纵的。
来源：剑10Test3阅读

They rigged up a tent-shaped scaffold directlyabove thetipof the horizontal column.
他们在水平柱顶端的正上方装配了一个帐篷状的脚手架。
来源：剑7 Test4 阅读

09 sullen [ˈsʌl.ən]

adj.沮丧的，闷闷不乐的；阴沉的

联想助记
(sole）唯一的+（lone）孤单的→孤单唯一→sullen沮丧的，闷闷不乐的

The sullen boy sits in the corner and buries his face in his hands.
沮丧的男孩坐在角落里，把脸埋在双手之间。

10 neutral [ˈnjuː.trəl $ ˈnuː-]

adj中立的；中性的；【物】中性的；n.中立国；中性色

词根助记
neutr=neuter中性的+al属于…的→中立的；中性的

He remained neutral in the disagreement, not taking either side.
他在这场争吵中保持中立，不偏任何一方。

The students were assigned to watch a video clip eliciting either humor, contentment, or neutral feelings.
学生们被分配观看一段会引起幽默、满足或中性情感的视频片段。
来源：剑15 test2 阅读

tags.tag: 百词斩, 单词, 学习

entry.title: 考研词汇精选-046
entry.content:
01 alight [əˈlaɪt]

vi. 偶然发现；下来；飞落；adj 烧着的；点亮着的

词根助记
a表加强，突然一下+light亮光→突然一下有亮光→alight偶然发现

The expert alights on a vase from the Tang dynasty.
这个专家偶然发现一个唐朝花瓶。

Historians had alighted on one interesting factor around the mid-18th century that required explanation.
历史学家在18世纪中期发现了一个需要解释的有趣因素。
来源：剑10 Test2 阅读

02 paracnute [ˌpærəˈklɪnɪkl]

n.降落伞；v. 跳伞

词根助记
para防，避开，保护十 chute降落→保护降落的人→parachute降落伞

The fox uses a parachute to descend.
这只狐狸用降落伞来下降。

… nylon started to be used in what had traditionally been silk products, such as
stockings and parachutes.
尼龙开始用于传统的丝绸制品，如长袜和降落伞。
来源：剑11 Test3 阅读

03 discriminate [dɪˈskrɪm.ɪ.neɪt]

v.歧视；区别，辨别

词根助记
dis分开，分离+crimin分辨+ate动词后缀→把东西分开来分辨→discriminate区别，辨别

Discriminating against others is a bad behavior.
歧视**他人是不好的行为。

04 wasp [wɒsp]

n.黄蜂

象形助记

I’m really afraid of wasps!
我真是很害怕黄蜂。

Meanwhile, a compound from the venom of the wasp Polybia paulista has potential in cancer treatment.
同时，来自黄蜂毒液的一种化合物有可能用于治疗癌症。
来源：剑14 Test3 阅读

05 tertiary [ˈtes.ə]

adj.第三的，第三级的；第三品级的；高等（教育）的；n.第三品级的神职人员；【地质学】第三纪

In Maslow’s hierarchy of needs, love and belonging are the tertiary needs.
在马斯洛的需求层次中，爱和归属是第三层次的需求。

06 carp [kɑːp $ kɑːrp]

n.鲤鱼；v.吹毛求疵

联想助记
他们开车（car）去看”鲤鱼”（carp）。

Share the carp image on Weibo and you might have some good luck.
微博转发此锦鲤，你或许能获得好运。

07 amputate [ˈæm.pjʊ.teɪt]

v.切断；切除；截肢

词根助记
am=ambi两个+put砍，切+ ate表动词→切成两个→amputate切断

They had to amputate his damaged leg below the knee.
他们必须切除他膝盖以下损坏的腿。

08 pliable [ˈplaɪ.ə.bl̩]

adj. 柔韧的；易弯的；圆滑的

词根助记
pli折叠+ able,表形容词 → pliable柔韧的

Paper clips are pliable, meaning they can be bent easily and hold their shape.
回形针很柔韧，这意味着它们易于弯曲并能保持形状。

… would peel the bark off … in the rainy season, when the wet bark was more
pliable.
会在雨季把…..的树皮剥下来，这时潮湿的树皮更柔韧。
来源：剑13 Test2 阅读

09 bead [biːd]

n.珠子；水珠

联想助记
吃面包（bread）的时候吃出了“珠子”（bead）。

On an abacus, each bead represents part of a number.
在算盘上，每颗珠子代表一个数。

.., this took the form of glazes used for coating stone beads.
它是一种釉，用来涂在石珠上。
来源：剑12 Test8 阅读

10 inauguration [/ɪˌnɔːɡjəˈreɪʃn/]

n. 落成典礼；京就职典礼；开幕仪式

词根助记
in向内，进入+augur预兆，开始+at(e)动词后缀+ion名词后缀→进入开始的形式→inauguration落成典礼

Today we attended the inauguration of this building.
今天我们参加了这个建筑的落成典礼。

Marie had the satisfaction of… and the inauguration in 1932 in Warsaw of the Radium Institute…
玛丽满意….以及1932年在华沙举行的镭研究所的落成典礼。
来源：剑9 Test4 阅读

tags.tag: 百词斩, 单词, 学习

entry.title: 考研词汇精选-045
entry.content:
01 zeal [ziːl]

n.热情，热心；激情

联想助记
她的”热情”（zeal）可以治愈（heal）身边人。

I can tell he is a soccer fanatic from the zeal he shows when watching the game.
从他观看比赛时显示出的极大热情中，我就知道他是个超级球迷。

02 execution [ˌeksɪˈkjuːʃn]

n.死刑；、实行，执行；演奏，表演；【法】签署；（高难动作的）表演

象形助记

The wolf faces the execution by beheading for committing murder.
这匹狼因犯谋杀罪而面临斩首的死刑。

…almost everyone in England had been appalled by the execution of his father.
几乎所有英国人都对他父亲的死刑感到震惊。
来源：剑17 Test1 阅读

03 corps [kɔːr $ kɔːr]

n.（由两个或以上师组成的）军，兵团；一群人；特别小组

象形助记

A corps of designers are discussing the new project.
一群设计师正在讨论新项目。

04 stew [ˈstiː.və.dɔːr $ -dɔːr]

n.炖肉（或菜）；鱼塘；炖肉块；v.炖，焖；使焦虑不安；受闷热

象形助记

I would like to eat a bowl of beef and potato stew.
我想吃一碗土豆烧牛肉。

You can also use it in drinks, soups or stews?
你也可以把它用在饮料、汤或炖菜中？
来源：剑15 Test4 阅读

05 reimbursement [/ˌriːɪmˈbɜːsmənt/]

n.赔偿；偿还；偿付

词根助记
reimburse偿还+ment表名词→reimbursement赔偿

After the car accident, he got his insurance reimbursement.
车祸发生后，他得到了应有的赔偿。

06 invigilate [ɪnˈvɪdʒɪleɪt]

v. 监考；监视

词根助记
in进入+vigil监视+ate表动词→invigilate监考；监视

There are two teachers in the classroom invigilating the exam.
教室里有两位老师在监考。

07 lethal [ˈliːθl]

adj. 致命的，致死的；危害极大的；杀伤性的；n. 致死因子

词根助记
leth毁灭+al形容词后缀→lethal致命的，致死的

A bite from this kind of snake is lethal!
被这种蛇咬一口可是致命的！

… protect against what was thought to be the lethal threat of miasmas - toxic air that spread disease.
防止被认为是致命威胁的瘴气–传播疾病的有毒空气。
来源：剑14 Test2 阅读

… pesticides have contributed to the emergence of a new breed of chemical- resistant, highly lethal superbugs.
.杀虫剂导致了一种新型抗化学药物、危害极大的超级细菌的出现。
来源：剑8 Test4 阅读

08 bias [ˈbaɪ.əs]

n.偏见；偏差；偏爱，偏好；偏心；倾斜；本命；v. 使有偏见

谐音助记
bias谐音：byeyes
仅靠视觉做出判断，所以带有一种”偏见”。

He has a biased mindset.
他充满偏见。

This notion is induced by the bias in its representation in museums and heritage centres.
这种观念是由其在博物馆和遗产中心的代表性偏见引起的。
来源：剑9 Test4 阅读

… it would contain a lot more bias than the presentations provided by experts.
它会比专家提供的报告包含更多的偏见。
来源：剑9 Test4 阅读

I’d best declare my own bias.
我最好声明我自己的偏好。
来源：剑15 Test1 阅读

09 essence [ˈesns]

n.本质，实质；精髓，精华

谐音助记
essence谐音：爱深思
爱深思的人才能领悟到事物的”本质”

Water is the essence of all life on earth.
水是地球上所有生命的本质。

The study of the cultural history of smell is an investigation into the essence of human culture.
对气味文化史的研究是对人类文化本质的探究。
来源：剑8 Test2 阅读

In 1660, the renowned French grammarians distilled the essence of language.
1660年，著名的法国语法学家提炼出语言的精髓。
来源：剑11 Test4 阅读

10 rave [reɪv]

n.热切赞扬，喧闹的宴会；胡言乱语；v.咆哮；胡言乱语；语无伦次地说；adj. 赞扬的

联想助记
他”热切赞扬”（rave）这一幻想（reverie)

The rave lasted all night. The music was awesome!
狂欢持续了一整夜，音乐太赞了！

tags.tag: 百词斩, 单词, 学习

entry.title: 考研词汇精选-044
entry.content:
01 friction [ˈfrɪk.ʃən]

n.摩擦，摩擦力；争执，冲突；【物】摩擦力

象形助记

Friction between the two hands generates some heat.
双手摩擦可以生热。

02 sore [sɔːr $ sɔːr]

adj. 疼痛的，酸痛的；恼火的；n.疮；伤处；adv.<古，诗〉同”sorely. a sore throat”

Ugh! My back feels so sore!
啊！我的背好酸啊！

03 concede [kənˈsiːd]

v.承认失败；承认；让步；让给，让与；让对手得分

词根助记
con表强调+cede行走，服从→concede承认；让步；v. 承认失败

In the fight with this crazy kangaroo, I had no choice but to concede.
在与这只疯狂的袋鼠的战斗中，我除了认输，别无选择。

04 napkin [ˈnæp.kɪn]

n.纸巾，餐巾，（小孩用的）尿布

词根助记
nap桌布+kin表名词，小→ napkin餐巾

You have something on your face. Here, take this napkin and wipe it off.
哎呀，你脸上沾了东西。来来来，快拿纸巾擦擦。

05 trek [trek]

n.艰苦跋涉；v.拉（货车），搬运

象形助记

These hikers are on a trek across the snowy mountain.
这群远足者正徒步翻过这座雪山。

The day began slowly, with Bingham trying to arrange sufficient mules for the next stage of the trek.
这一天过得很慢，宾厄姆试图为下阶段的长途跋涉安排足够的骡子。
来源：剑12 Test6 阅读

06 burgeon [ˈbɜːdʒən]

v.发芽，迅速成长；n.嫩枝

象形助记

When spring comes, all the seeds begin to burgeon.
当春天到来的时候，所有的种子开始发芽。

07 feudal [ˈfjuː.dəl]

adj. 封建时代的；领地的；世仇的

词根助记
feud封地+al具有…性质的→feudal封建制度的；领地的；世仇的

This map shows the feudal land system during the Western Zhou Dynasty.
这幅地图展示了西周初年的封建土地制度。

08 pave [peɪv]

v.为…铺平道路，创造条件；铺（路），铺筑；铺(路)，铺筑

谐音助记
pave谐音：佩服；他们对中国”铺设”的高铁很佩服。

The financial aids pave the way for poor students’ study.
经济援助为贫困学生的学习铺平了道路。

In the same way, random, arbitrary or accidental mutations of ideas may help pave the way for advances in science.
同样，想法的随机、武断或意外突变可能有助于为科学的进步铺平道路。
来源：剑17 Test2 阅读

Some wells are vast, open craters with hundreds of steps paving each sloping side.
有些井是巨大的露天环形山，每个倾斜的侧面都铺有数百级台阶。
有些井是巨大的、敞开的陨石坑，每一侧都有数百个台阶。
来源：剑10 Test1 阅读

09 stale [steɪl]

adj.（食物）不新鲜的；陈腐的，缺乏新鲜感的；走味的；（空气）不清新的；v. 变得不新鲜；变陈旧；n.(猎人做掩蔽用的）假马；笑柄

联想助记
一直停留着（stay）的食物就是”不新鲜的”（stale）食物。

The bread is stale； don’t eat it.
面包不新鲜了，别吃。

10 amend [əˈmend]

v.修正；改进，改善；修订；改过自新；【财】修改

词根助记
a加强+mend改正→不断改错→amend改进

She amended her boyfriend’s grammar mistake.
她修正了她男朋友的语法错误。

tags.tag: 百词斩, 单词, 学习

entry.title: 考研词汇精选-043
entry.content:
01 displacement

n.移位，位移，排水量；替代；被迫迁徙，流亡；【物】位移

词根助记
dis分开+place地方+ment名词后缀→换个地方→displacement移位

There has been a displacement because the cube has moved.
正方体移动了，所以它发生了位移。

According to Archimedes’ principle of displacement, floating objects displace their own weight in water.
根据阿基米德的排水原理，漂浮物在水中排开自身的重量。
来源：剑11 Test1 阅读

02 fodder [ˈfɒd.ər $ ˈfɑː.dɚ]

n.饲料，草料；（创作的）素材；弹药；v.喂

象形助记

The alfalfa plant is widely used as animal fodder.
苜科植物广泛用作动物饲料。

The revolution involved intensive commercial farming and the growing of animal fodder
这场革命包括集约化商业农业和动物饲料的种植
来源：剑8 Test2 阅读

03 reminiscent [ˌrem.ɪˈnɪs.ənt]

adj.暗示….的，使人联想….的；怀旧的，回忆的

词根助记
reminisc回忆+ent…的→reminiscent怀旧的

This digital camera is reminiscent of an old vintage film camera.
这款数码相机令人联想到老式胶片相机。

04 fastidious [fæˈstɪdiəs]

adj 难讨好的，爱挑剔的

词根助记
fast（绝食）+idious（看作tedious，乏味的）→因乏味而绝食→挑剔的

He is a fastidious person and likes everything to be perfectly clean.
他是个挑剔的人，喜欢一切都非常干净。

05 alga [ælˈfælfə]

n.海藻；水藻；藻类

词根助记
alg -表示”藻类”+a →alga海藻

Alga can be made into a tasty dish.
海藻可以做成一道美味佳肴。

06 placard [ˈplæk.ɑːd $ -ɑːrd]

n.招贴，海报，标语牌；v.张贴布告，公布某事

词根助记
pla=place 放置+ card 卡片→粘贴卡片→placard贴广告、贴标语

His friends in the airport were carrying placards to welcome him back.
他的朋友们在机场举着标语牌迎接他。

07 explicit [ɪkˈsplɪs.ɪt]

adj 明确的；直率的，直截了当的；[描绘性或暴力的语言或画面】清晰露骨的；【计】显式

词根助记
ex出+plic折叠+it→说话不重叠的→explicit明确的

The map shows an explicit route to me.
这张地图给我指出了明确的路线。

Music is a purely abstract art form, devoid of language or explicit ideas.
音乐是一种纯粹的抽象艺术形式，缺乏语言或明确的思想。
来源：剑12 Test7 阅读

08 profane [prəˈfeɪn]

adj. 亵渎神圣的，不敬的，粗俗的，污秽的；v.亵渎，玷污（神圣），滥用；n. 未受秘传的人

词根助记
pro在前+fan庙+e→在神庙前面→profane亵渎神圣的，不敬的，粗俗的，污秽的

Sleeping in a church is profane.
在教堂里睡觉是不敬的。

09 brink [brɪŋk]

n（尤指崖边）边缘

象形助记

Be careful on the brink-you might fall off.
站在悬崖边上的时候要小心，你可能会跌下去。

For soils on the brink, that may be too late.
对于处于边缘的土壤，这可能为时已晚。
来源：剑13 Test4 阅读

10 triumph [ˈtraɪ.əmf]

n.胜利，凯旋；喜悦，狂喜；vi.成功，获胜

联想助记
“胜利”（triumph）后感到“喜悦”，于是吹起了喇叭（trumpet）

“I win!” he shouted in triumph.
“我赢了！”他在胜利时喊道。

… since in everyday life its triumphs are usually taken for granted.
因为在日常生活中，它的胜利通常被认为是理所当然的。
来源：剑11 Test4 阅读

tags.tag: 百词斩, 单词, 学习

entry.title: 考研词汇精选-042
entry.content:
01 hostile [ˌaɪ.siː.biːˈem]

adj.(生长环境）恶劣的；敌对的，敌方的；怀有敌意的；不受欢迎的

词根助记
来自拉丁语hostis,敌人，+ile….的→有敌意的→hostile敌意的；（生长环境）恶劣的

There are almost no plants here because of the hostile environment.
因为环境恶劣，这里几乎寸草不生。

We will have to make the turbines robust because the sea is a hostile environment.
我们必须使涡轮机坚固耐用，因为海洋环境恶劣。
来源：剑9 Test3 阅读

02 scrupulous [ˌsaɪ.ə.miːzˈtwɪnz]

adj 小心谨慎的；严谨的；细心的

词根助记
scrupul 犹豫+ ous…的→做决定之前犹豫→小心谨慎的

The player looks scrupulous when he adjusts his position to hit the ball.
这个参赛选手调整击球位置时看起来很谨慎。

03 gamble [ˈɡæm.bl̩]

n.冒险；赌博；v.赌博；投机；打赌；赌输

象形助记

He is taking a gamble climbing in the extreme winter.
他在极度寒冷的冬季冒险攀登。

His gamble paid off, though, and the ship was the fastest vessel in the wool trade for ten years.
然而，他的这一冒险获得了成功，这艘船是十年来羊毛贸易中最快的船。
来源：剑13 Test4 阅读

04 excavate [ˈekskəveɪt]

v.挖掘，挖出；挖 (空），挖(洞)；

The boy is excavating the land to plant the tree.
这个男孩正在挖土种树。

The archaeologist … who excavated most of the pyramid and complex, believes ..
挖掘了大部分金字塔和建筑群的考古学家….认为
来源：剑16 Test1 阅读

This was because the mountain could be excavated
这是因为山体可以被挖空的
来源：剑16 Test4 阅读

05 appealing [əˈpiːlɪŋ]

adj 吸引人的；打动人心的

词根助记
appeal吸引 + ing…的→吸引人的，动人的

The kids found the smells from their mother’s dinner quite appealing.
孩子们觉得母亲做的晚餐香味诱人。

Its positive message is more appealing.
它的积极信息更有吸引力。
来源：剑12 Test8 阅读

06 dainty [ˈdeɪnti]

adj 优雅，考究；小巧精致的；优美的；讲究的；可口的；n.适口的食物

词根助记
dain（dign，高贵）+ty-－优雅的；讲究的

This set of Chinese porcelain is very dainty.
这套中国瓷器非常考究。

07 blunt [blʌnt]

adj 钝的；直率的；v.减弱(感觉或需求等)；变钝

联想助记
一看到蓝色（blue），我快乐的感觉就减弱(blunt)了

These blunt pencils are no good for writing with.
这些钝铅笔不适合写字。

08 agitation [ˌædʒɪˈteɪʃn]

n.焦虑，忧虑；摇动；煽动

象形助记

Apparently she is in a state of agitation.
显然她此刻身处焦虑之中。

09 strand [strænd]

v.使滞留，使搁浅；使陷入困境；n.(绳子、线等的）股，缕；一个组成部分；海滨，河
岸，海滩，湖滨

联想助记
很多人被”滞留”（strand），只能焦急地站(stand）在那里等待。

Some human behaviors have been accused of causing certain whales to strand.
人类的一些行为被指控导致了某些鲸鱼搁浅。

… because the majority of animals were not feeding when they stranded.
….因为大多数动物在搁浅时没有进食。
来源：剑9 Test1 听力

… ready for the insertion of strands of extinct animal DNA to create something new.
.准备插入已灭绝动物的DNA链，以创造新的东西。
来源：剑15 test2 阅读

10 kindle [ˈkɪndl]

v.点燃，激起；着火；照亮；煽动

象形助记

The man needs to kindle the fire to stay warm.
这个男人需要点火来保持温暖。

tags.tag: 百词斩, 单词, 学习

entry.title: 考研词汇精选-041
entry.content:
01 calamity [kəˈlæm.ɪ.ti $ -ə.t̬i]

n.大灾祸，不幸之事

词根助记
calam不幸+ity表名词→灾难，不幸

A great calamity is occurring, how can we survive?
巨大的灾难将要发生，我们该如何幸存？

02 render [ˈrendə(r)]

v.使成为，致使，使处于（某种状态）；提供，给予；（以某种方式）表达，表现；翻译；粉刷，往（墙上）抹灰；将（脂肪）熬成油，使熔化；；（提供）服务；递交；舍弃；n.粉刷，打底，交纳

词根助记
rend给+ er表动词→给→render给予；使成为

The earthquake rendered hundreds of people homeless.
地震使数百人无家可归。

Silent genes accumulate random mutations, they reasoned, eventually rendering them useless.
他们推断，沉默的基因会积累随机突变，最终使它们变得无用。
来源：剑10 Test4 阅读

If appropriate works of fine art could be rendered permanently …
如果合适的艺术作品能够被永久地提供….
来源：剑10 Test2 阅读

03 blade [bleɪd]

n.桨叶,（飞机、植物的）叶片；刀刃，刀锋；刀，刀锋

谐音助记
blade谐音：不累的；风扇的桨叶一直转”不累的”。

The dew gathered on the blades of grass.
露水在草叶上凝结。

Work on designs for the new turbine blades and sites are well advanced .
新涡轮机叶片和场地的设计工作进展顺利
来源：剑9 Test3 阅读

04 deformation [ˌdiːfɔːˈmeɪʃn]

n.变形；畸形

词根助记
de坏+form形状+ation名词后缀→变形；丑化

The deformation in this key makes it unusable.
钥匙变形了，无法使用。

05 bust [bʌst]

n.半身塑像；胸部；破产；v.打碎；搜捕；降级；终止；adj 破产的；打碎的

联想助记
最好的（best）的结果是不”破产”（bust)

The bust of Pythagoras honors the great Greek mathematician.
这尊毕达哥拉斯半身像是用来纪念这位伟大的古希腊数学家的。

06 boast [bəʊst]

(地方、机构等）自豪地拥有（好的事物）；吹嘘；夸耀；自负；n.夸耀

词根助记
boa膨胀 + st →吹牛→ boast夸耀

The house boasts a big pool.
这个房子有一个大泳池。

The huge and unexpected success of the Parisian bike-sharing programme，which now boasts more than 20,000 bicycles…
巴黎的自行车共享项目取得了意想不到的巨大成功，现在已经拥有超过20000辆自行车
来源：剑14 Test1 阅读

07 cease [siːs]

v. 停止，结束；终止；n.停止，停息

谐音助记
cease谐音：息事；息事宁人让这件事”停止、结束”

The rain ceased and the rainbow showed up.
雨停了，彩虹出现在天边。

ceased to be land creatures altogether and reverted to the full marine habits of their remote ancestors.
完全不再是陆地生物，恢复了它们远古祖先的海洋习性。
来源：剑9 Test1 阅读

08 whisker [ˈwɪs.kər $ -kɚ]

n.胡须；腮须

象形助记

My cat went to a barber to style his whisker.
我家猫去了一家理发店给胡须做造型。

09 compliment [ˈkɒm.plɪ.mənt $ ˈkɑːm-]

n.恭维，问候；【计】补集；v.赞扬，祝贺

词根助记
com加强意义+pli充满+ment→充满(敬意)→compliment赞美，祝贺；恭维，问候

The couple were satisfied with their dinner and paid the chef a compliment.
这对夫妇对晚餐很满意，还称赞了厨师。

10 tactic [ˈtæk.tɪk]

n.手段，策略；adj. 按顺序的；依次排列的

联想助记
你们准备用什么”策略”(tactic）来解决(tackle)这个问题呢?

The coach is explaining tactics for the following soccer game.
教练正在讲解接下来的足球赛中要用的战术。

… they plan tactics for each game.
…他们为每场比赛制定策略。
来源：剑7 Test2 听力

tags.tag: 百词斩, 单词, 学习

entry.title: 考研词汇精选-040
entry.content:
01 terribly [ˈter.ə.bli]

adv.极度地，非常；可怕地；非常

词根助记
terr=frighten恐，怕+ ibly….地→terribly非常；可怕地；极度地

He was terribly sorry for what he had done.
他对他做过的事感到非常抱歉。

02 diction [ˈdɪk.ʃən]

n.措词；吐字，发音

词根助记
dic说，断言+ion表行为，状态→diction吐字；措辞

He will choose the appropriate diction depending on whether he is speaking or writing.
他会根据自己是在说还是在写来选择合适的措词。

03 respective [ˈrev.ər.ənd $ -rənd $ -ɚ.ənd]

adj. 分别的；各自的

联想助记
我们要尊重（respect）别人，管好“各自的”（respective）的事就行了。

After the party, we went back into our respective rooms.
派对结束后，我们回到了各自的房间。

04 decree [dɪˈkriː]

v.命令，判决，颁布；n.法令，政令；【法】法令，政令，裁决，判决

词根助记
de向下+cree(d)信条→向下颁布的信条→decree命令；法令

The emperor decrees that everybody must give him money.
皇帝命令所有人都得给他钱。

05 lapse [læps]

n.失误，过失；(时间）流逝；行为失检；v.背弃，放弃（宗教信仰）；退步，倒退，衰退；失效

词根助记
laps滑，滑走+e→滑离正确的道路→lapse犯错误；失误

I had a lapse in judgment and put too much soap in the laundry.
我做了个失误的判断，洗衣服的时候放了太多肥皂。

06 grit [ɡrɪt]

n.沙粒；决心，勇气；v.下定决心，咬紧牙关；研磨；在…上铺砂砾

象形助记

They would spread grit on roads in winter to make them less slippery.
冬天，他们会在路上撒上沙粒，使路面不那么滑。

07 vanquish [ˈvæŋ.kwɪʃ]

v.征服，击败

象形助记

The knight finally vanquished the dragon.
骑士最终击败了恶龙。

08 precarious [prɪˈkeə.ri.əs $ -ˈker.i-]

adj. 危险的；说不定的；不稳定的；可疑的

象形助记

The car is in a precarious situation. It could fall off the cliff anytime.
这辆车处在一种危险状态下，它随时可能掉下悬崖。

09 droop [druːp]

v.低垂，凋萎，萎靡；n.下垂；消沉

联想助记
花朵从高处掉(drop）下去变得”低垂”(droop)了。

The flowers drooped in the sun.
花朵在阳光下枯萎了。

10 conceivable [kənˈsiː.və.bl̩]

adj. 想得到的，可想象的；可能的

词根助记
conceiv=conceive构思+able能..的→conceive大家一起抓=构想+able能..的→conceivable可想像的

It’s conceivable that she’ll win the scholarship, because she studies so hard.
她得到奖学金是可以想得到的，因为她学习非常用功。

tags.tag: 百词斩, 单词, 学习

entry.title: 考研词汇精选-039
entry.content:
01 macabre [məˈkɑːbrə]

adj 骇人的，恐怖的

This macabre display shows the skulls of some of the regime’s victims.
这个骇人的展览陈列出某个政权下的牺牲品的头骨。

02 obliterate [əˈblɪtəreɪt]

v. 消灭；涂去；冲刷；忘掉

If an asteroid were to hit the earth, it would obliterate all of us.
如果一个小行星撞上了地球，它将会使我们灭绝。

03 relief [rɪˈliːf]

n.浮雕；(不快过后的）宽慰，轻松；安慰；缓解；减轻；凸显，起伏；救济金；救济物资；换班人；接替人；对比；救济，援助；‘【法】救济

联想助记
信念(belief)可以”减轻”(relief)人的痛苦。

Each side of coins has pictures on them in relief.
硬币的两面都有浮雕图案。

… and even with duplication of the surface relief of the painting.
甚至与绘画表面的浮雕重复。
来源：剑10 Test2 阅读

04 cubism [ˈkjuːbɪzəm]

(艺术上的）立体派

词根助记
cub=cube立体的+ism学术流派→立体派

We’re studying cubism in Art History class.
我们正在艺术史课上研习立体主义。

05 cardinal [ˈkɑːdɪnl]

adj. 基本的；主要的；n.红衣主教；基数

联想助记
cardin（卡丁车）是一种”基本的”（cardinal）赛车。

Cardinal numbers are numbers that tell you how many things there are in a group.
基数是告诉你一组中有多少事物的数字。

06 faith [feɪθ]

n.信心；宗教信仰；信任；相信；int.实在，确实

The man has faith in himself.
这个男人对自己有信心。

He aimed to restore people’s faith in the monarchy.
他旨在恢复人们对君主制的信心。
来源：剑17 Test1 阅读

Hypnosis, yoga, Silva mind-control, religious ceremonies and faith healing are all associated with successful suggestion., …
催眠、瑜伽、Silva精神控制、宗教仪式和信仰治疗都与成功的暗示有关，…
来源：剑7 Test1 阅读

07 comet [ˈkɒmɪt]

n.彗星

象形助记

The comet is approaching the sun.
彗星正在向太阳靠近。

comets instruments thermometer storms telegraph
彗星仪器温度计风暴电报
来源：剑14 Test2听力

08 perspective [ˈpɜː.speks $ ˈpɝː-]

n（思考问题的）角度，观点；（对事物的）合理判断，正确认识；远景；透视图，透视法，透视效果；【财】观点；adj. 透视的

联想助记
per所有的+ spect看+ive →从所有的”角度”（perspective）看待事物。

He thinks about these sharing bikes from a different perspective.
他从不同的角度考虑了这些共享单车。

from a third-party perspective, as though giving advice to a friend.
从第三方的角度来看，就好像给朋友提建议一样。
来源：剑16 Test2 阅读

09 groove [ɡruːv]

n.【建】凹槽；最佳状态；惯例；v.在….开出槽；形成沟槽

联想助记
“凹槽”（groove）里有一只鹅（goose）

Most sliding doors move inside the grooves.
大多数的滑动门都在凹槽里移动。

from the extinct Easter Island palm show tiny grooves, made by the teeth of Polynesian rats.
从已经灭绝的复活节岛棕榈树上可以看到波利尼西亚老鼠的牙齿形成的微小凹槽。
来源：剑11 Test2阅读

10 skyrocket [ˈskaɪˌrɒk.ɪt $ -ˌrɑː.kɪt]

v.陡升，猛涨，突飞猛进；n.流星焰火；高空探测火箭

象形助记

The company’s revenue skyrocketed last year.
该公司去年的收入猛增。

tags.tag: 百词斩, 单词, 学习

entry.title: 考研词汇精选-038
entry.content:
01 precinct [ˈpriː.sɪŋkt]

n.管理区，管辖区；选区；界限，范围

词根助记
pre…前的，预先+ cinct捆→预先捆好的→precinct管辖区

This country is made up of many precincts.
这个国家由许多辖区组成。

02 infirmary [ɪnˈfɜːməri]

n.医院，医务室 (尤指学校等附设的病房或配药处)

An infirmary is a small hospital where patients are taken care of.
医务处是用于照顾病人的小医院。

03 contemplate [ˈkɒntəmpleɪt]

v.沉思；对….周密考虑；注视；【财】考量；【法】凝视，反复观察，沉思，默想，仔细考虑，仔细估量，打算，计划

词根助记
con共同+templ庙+ ate动词后缀→像庙中人一样深思→contemplate静思

Through this gesture, the actor tries to show what it looks like to contemplate.
这位演员试图用这个动作来表达沉思的感觉。

04 ovation [əʊˈveɪ.ʃən $ oʊ-]

n.热烈欢迎，热烈鼓掌

The performance ended with a thunderous ovation.
表演结束时，雷鸣般的欢呼声响起。

05 dumb [dʌm]

adj.哑的，暂不说话的，愚笨的；v. 使沉默
联想助记
吃了毒（du）面包（mb），变成了“哑的”。

It’s dumb to row on the cracked soil.
在龟裂的土地上划船是件很蠢的事情。

their … would strike an engineer dumb with admiration.
他们的…..会让一个工程师佩服得哑口无言。
来源：剑7Test1 阅读

06 ceramic [səˈræmɪk]

n.陶瓷制品；制陶艺术；adj. 陶器的，陶瓷的

The man is making ceramic pots.
这个男人正在制作陶罐。

07 crucial [ˈkruː.ʃəl]

adj.关键的，至关重要的；决定性的

词根助记
cruc十字形，交叉+ial具有…性质的→十字路口→ crucial关键的

This crucial round will decide who will win the game.
这个关键回合将决定谁会赢得比赛。

It is crucial for success in any field to understand how the iconoclastic mind works.
了解反传统的思维方式，对在任何领域的成功都至关重要。
来源：剑9 Test2 阅读

08 swell [swel]
